subQuestion.content: Describe the room you are in.
subQuestion.suggestion:
CON NGƯỜI: In this room, I can see many people: 3 teachers (examiners/ supervisors) and 20 students (examinees, test takers). The teachers look very serious, they are walking around to make sure everything runs smoothly. The students look very confident.

KHÔNG GIAN: The room is quite large/ small.

ĐỒ VẬT: I can see many computers and headsets on desks for candidates.

subQuestion.content: Please tell me about the last thing you saw on television.
subQuestion.suggestion: (WHAT) The last thing I saw on TV was a movie. (HOW) It was interesting. (HOW OFTEN) I watch TV twice a week at home on weekends. (WHEN) In the evening, after dinner, I open the TV and watch with my mom (WHO). That movie was great and we felt over the moon (HOW). It helps me reduce stress after a long day. (LỢI ÍCH)

subQuestion.content: What is the food like in your country?
subQuestion.suggestion: I love (cooking) many dishes such as fried chicken, Pho or beef noodles but If I had to choose one, I would go for fried eggs. It is very easy to make. I often eat it for breakfast and sometimes for lunch and dinner. It is tasty/yummy/delicious when going with chili sauce.

subQuestion.content: Describe the picture
subQuestion.suggestion:
• There are three people in the picture.
  • The man holding a camera seems to be a cameraman while the two people recorded, including a woman looking like a reporter/ correspondent and a man being interviewed.
  • The reporter is holding a microphone towards the man in the vest.
  • They seem to give news about politics, finance, or business.
  • ﻿The background behind them is seemingly the outer space of a building/ skyscraper with glass doors/ windows.

subQuestion.content: Do you prefer reading newspapers or watching the news?
subQuestion.suggestion:
• Both are good/ effective ways to inform yourself about worldwide business. 
  • I prefer watching the news for several reasons.
  • It is the fastest/ quickest way to receive information and news around the world.
  • It is completely free as long as you have a television at home, since you have to buy newspapers on a daily basis.
  • It is more eye-catching, because the images on the TV are visualized with bright colors and lively sounds.

subQuestion.content: Why do people need to watch the news?
subQuestion.suggestion:
• Watching the news is important/ crucial/ necessary for people.
  • It helps us to be informed about current affairs and breaking news all over the world.
  • People will be more knowledgeable of what is going on in our society, they will not be left behind in this ever-changing world.
  • Not only entertaining but also informative.
  • For example: during the Covid-19 pandemic, people should always keep themselves up-to-date about the situation, the death toll or governmental policies applied to all citizens during the lockdown by watching the news.

questions.content: 45s/câu trả lời - trả lời từng câu

subQuestion.content: Tell me what you see from the two pictures
subQuestion.suggestion:
• Looking at the pictures, there are two women, both in the library.
  • In the first picture: There is a woman with tied short black hair in a white T-shirt standing in front of a bookshelf. She appears to be choosing a suitable book to read. Behind her stood a man, who is also looking for a book from the shelf, and there are three people in total, sitting and reading their books.
  • The second picture focused on a woman doing her academic work. She is wearing a pair of glasses and concentrating on the laptop screen, while also taking notes on her book. The setting behind her looks like the library hall with many people there.

subQuestion.content: Do you prefer reading printed books or e-books?
subQuestion.suggestion:
• Although e-books are convenient and easily accessible, I still opt to read printed books.
  • I just love the feeling of holding a book in my hands, smelling the smell of paper and flipping through the pages.
  • It helps to reduce screen time and eye strain.
  • It brings me joy whenever I can come by a book from my favorite author as a reward for myself after days of hard work.

subQuestion.content: Does technology affect the way we read books?
subQuestion.suggestion:
• Definitely, technology has a great impact on how we read books.
  • The advent of e-books appears to replace the role of printed books, since it is an economical investment and portable. 
  • Readers can also read books from online platforms free- of-charge or make a payment to read several books there.
  • Social media has reduced readership in our daily life, making people less interested in reading books.

questions.content:
2 phút/ 3 câu - trả lời liên tục

  1. Tell me a time when you were in a hurry.
  2. How do you feel?
  3. Modern life makes us busier and more rushed. What do you think?
questions.suggestion:
1.Tell me a time when you were in a hurry.

  • Speaking of an occasion when I was in a hurry, the memory of when I attended my brother’s wedding comes to my mind.
  • As I had been living in a city a thousand kilometers from my hometown, where my brother planned to hold his wedding, I had to take a flight to get back to my hometown. 
  • Unfortunately, on my taxi heading for the airport, I completely forgot my phone at home and had to turn back to retrieve it. 
  • Luckily, I went to get the boarding check-in time, which is only 5 minutes before I missed the flight.

2. How do you feel?

  • Heading for the airport, I was worrying about missing the flight all the way.
  •  This unforgettable experience taught me to do preparations more carefully and remember to check things before leaving. 
  • I felt so lucky that I didn’t miss the flight. 

3. Modern life makes us busier and more rushed. What do you think?

  • I believe modern life makes us pressed for time and busier.
  • The competitive market leads to the rising demand among employers to perform their best at work and work overtime to contribute to the productivity and operation of their companies/ agencies.
  • Materialism is becoming prevalent, people work day and night to earn more and more money so that they can realize the ideal life of being financially secure and able to afford accommodations and settle down in big cities.

subQuestion.content: Tell me about the last time you went to the cinema.
subQuestion.suggestion: The last time I went to the cinema was last weekend (WHEN). The cinema was quite large and beautiful (HOW). My friend and I go to the cinema once a week (WHEN). We often eat popcorn and drink cola while watching (WHAT). The movies are always interesting and we all feel over the moon after that (HOW). Sometimes, I stay over at her house.

subQuestion.content: Which dish is your favorite to cook?
subQuestion.suggestion: I love (cooking) many dishes such as fried chicken, Pho or beef noodles but If I had to choose one, I would go for fried eggs. It is very easy to make. I often eat it for breakfast and sometimes for lunch and dinner. It is tasty/yummy/delicious when going with chili sauce.

subQuestion.content: Which is the best way to travel around your country?
subQuestion.suggestion: There are many ways to travel around my country such as by car, bus, train, plane, and motorbike but I think the best way to travel around my country is by car. It helps us to go wherever we want and bring stuff at the same time. Also, It gives people the chance to set their own schedule and stop on the road to sightsee.

questions.questionTitle: Speaking - Học kĩ năng mới - Part 2

subQuestion.content: Describe the picture.
subQuestion.suggestion: • Looking at the picture, I can see three people: a man, a woman and a child. They must be a small family. The father has curly hair and is wearing a navy sweater, while the mother is wearing a scarf on her head with white sweater and jeans. The man is sitting on the sofa and is working on his laptop, looking very attentive, while the woman is lying on the sofa, embracing her sleeping child. The sofa is plain gray, with a beige and an orange pillow. They look so peaceful together and the room is cozy. I like this picture because it reminds me of an ideal family.

subQuestion.content: Tell me the last time you worked when others slept.
subQuestion.suggestion: • The other night, I had a tight deadline for a project due the next morning. My mother, exhausted from a long day, had fallen asleep early. So I had to tiptoe into my home office and open my computer screen. While my mother was peacefully asleep in the next room, I dove into my work. As the night wore on, my eyelids grew heavy, but I pressed on, because of the urgency of the deadline. However, I was so nervous that typing the keyboard might wake my mom up in the middle of the night. Finally, just as the first light of dawn began to peek through the curtains, I put the finishing touches on my project. With a sigh of relief, I quietly shut down my computer and tiptoed back to my room, careful not to wake my sleeping mother. As I crawled into bed, I couldn't help but feel proud of my dedication and the beautiful work I had accomplished, all while my mother slept peacefully.

subQuestion.content: The older we get, the more responsibility we have. Do you agree?
subQuestion.suggestion: • Yes, as we grow older, we often encounter new roles and challenges in our personal and professional lives. These can include career advancements, starting families, managing finances, and contributing to our communities. With each milestone, there's often an increase in responsibilities, and we need to face them responsibly so that we can gain greater roles and achievements in life.

questions.questionTitle: Speaking - Học kĩ năng mới - Part 3
questions.content: 45s/câu trả lời - trả lời từng câu

subQuestion.content: Tell me what you see in the two photographs?
subQuestion.suggestion:
• In the first photo, there is a young man sitting on a couch and reading a book. He has brunette hair and a beard. He is wearing a red checkered shirt and blue jeans. He is sitting on a beige couch and is reading a book, while also holding a cup of coffee.He looks so chilled and relaxed, but also really concentrated. I like this picture because I also enjoy reading books very much.
  • In the second picture, I can see a little boy sitting in front of the computer screen. He is wearing headphones and is probably using switches to play the video game shown on the computer screen. I can not see his face but I think he enjoys it very much.

subQuestion.content: How do you schedule your day to include focused studying and entertainment breaks?
subQuestion.suggestion: • I often use the Pomodoro technique, which is a great tool to help me focus better when studying. This is a structured series of shorter periods of focus that builds in time for your brain to take a break. For example, I will work hard on my academic workloads for 45 minutes and then have a 10-minute short break. This not only motivates me to focus on my study but also provides me the well-deserved break to entertain myself. This method keeps stress at bay and makes my study process more pleasant and enjoyable.

subQuestion.content: Playing video games is not for adults. What do you think?
subQuestion.suggestion: • I respectfully disagree with this. Video games can be enjoyed by people of all ages, including adults. Many adults find video games to be a fun and engaging form of entertainment, and they can even provide stress relief and cognitive stimulation. It's all about personal preference and finding activities that bring joy and fulfillment. However, one should not spend too much time on video games, they should play in moderation.

questions.questionTitle: Speaking - Học kĩ năng mới - Part 4
questions.content:
2 phút/ 3 câu - trả lời liên tục

  1. Tell me the last time you learn something new.
  2. How did you feel? 
  3. Lifelong learning is necessary for everyone. Do you agree?
questions.suggestion:
Tell me the last time you learn something new.

  • As far as I remember it was probably around when I was in high school. Back then, my English was terrible, I mean, I couldn’t understand most of what the teachers taught me. I really fell behind with my study. And as the final exam is coming, I figured out I need to do something to deal with the situation. And luckily, one of my friends recommended I register for a course at an English institution named Tentis. I decided to give it a shot because the centre has a good reputation for its innovative teaching methods. Initially, I have to admit that it was really tough from the pronunciation to the grammar, and even the vocabulary. But thanks to the patience of the teachers, I was slowly getting better with my English. I did a test in the end and I was overjoyed about the high grade I received. 


How did you feel? 

  • I gotta say that the whole experience just fostered my passion for English again, and English now has become an integral part of my life. I felt extremely delighted seeing my English getting better and my test results were higher than expected. This was a worthy investment to improve myself. Now, I really enjoy learning English and it is not difficult for me to understand its grammar and vocabulary anymore.


Lifelong learning is necessary for everyone. Do you agree? 

  • Absolutely! Lifelong learning isn't just beneficial; it's becoming increasingly necessary in today's world. Technology, society, and the economy are always changing, which means that the skills and knowledge we acquire today may become obsolete tomorrow. Therefore, committing to continuous learning ensures that we can adapt to these changes by equipping ourselves with up-to-date information and knowledge, remain competitive in the job market, and pursue new opportunities. Furthermore, in a rapidly changing global landscape, lifelong learning promotes social and cultural awareness. By actively seeking out new knowledge and experiences, we can discover new passions, deepen our understanding of the world, engage with diverse perspectives.

items.title: Thứ mà bạn muốn nhưng không có được

subQuestion.content: Please tell me about your family.
subQuestion.suggestion:
(Số thành viên, gồm ai) My family has ... people: my dad, my mom, my sister

and me. (Nghề nghiệp & tuổi) My dad is a doctor and he is 60 years old, my

mom is a teacher and she is 50 years old. My sister is 30 years old and is a

nurse. I am a student and this year I am 20.

subQuestion.content: Please tell me about a famous place in your country.
subQuestion.suggestion:
Địa điểm nào (My favorite/ A famous place in my country is ... It is famous for its wild beauty and many

coffee shops/ modern structure/ up-to-date amenities.

Thời tiết (The weather is so nice and cool.),

Con người (The people there are very kind and friendly) and Đồ ăn (the food/ cuisine is so delicious).

Giá cả (Plus, everything there is cheap/ expensive). People often go to ... in the summer and autumn. All

members of my family love this place.

subQuestion.content: Tell me about your hobby.
subQuestion.suggestion:
I enjoy many hobbies such as watching films, reading books, listening to

music, playing sports, and going shopping. I often do what I love on

weekends and in my free time. For example, my mom and I go shopping

every Sunday. I prefer cartoons, rock and badminton.

questions.questionTitle: Speaking - Thứ mà bạn muốn nhưng không có được - Part 2

subQuestion.content: Describe this picture?
subQuestion.suggestion: Looking at this picture, I can see a group of people going hiking together. They all wear jackets and wool hats with backpacks behind. They also hold trekking poles. The man standing in the left corner is wearing sunglasses. Behind them is a mountain view and blue sky. Overall, they are probably a group of friends enjoyin their vacation by hiking together.

subQuestion.content: When was the last time you went somewhere with your friends?
subQuestion.suggestion: The last time I hung out with my friends was last weekend. It was my friend’s birthday. We celebrated it at a restaurant.The restaurant is not a luxurious place, but they are spotless and there are many plants there since my friends love nature. We decided to have a three-course meal there and then went to a local pub to get some drinks. It was a fun and memorable experience.

subQuestion.content: Why do people enjoy doing things together?
subQuestion.suggestion: People enjoy doing things together because it is a time to socialize, to share stories and laugh together. It also strengthens our bonds, enabling us to understand each other better.

questions.questionTitle: Speaking - Thứ mà bạn muốn nhưng không có được - Part 3
questions.content: In this part I'm going to ask you to compare two pictures and I will then ask you two questions about them. You will have 45 seconds for each response. Begin speaking when you hear this sound.

subQuestion.content: Tell me what you see in the two pictures.
subQuestion.suggestion:
In the first picture I can see a man in a vest. Surrounding him are long stairs. He is probably in his house which is a luxurious mansion. 

The second picture, there is a man sitting at a desk probably working. The room is decorated in a minimalist way, with its main colors being black and white. In front of the man are 2 windows which provide enough natural light for the room.

subQuestion.content: Where would you rather live?
subQuestion.suggestion: I would rather live in the room in the second picture because I am interested in minimalism. I would prefer a room which is modern enough and caters to my needs but it must also be neat and clean.

subQuestion.content: Why do people like to decorate their home?
subQuestion.suggestion: I believe it is because decorating rooms creates a sense of joy, motivating people to start their day and makes them feel like staying at home.

questions.questionTitle: Speaking - Thứ mà bạn muốn nhưng không có được - Part 4
questions.content:
2 phút/ 3 câu - trả lời liên tục

  1. Tell me about a time when you wanted something but couldn't have it.
  2. How did you feel about it?
  3. Material prossessions can't bring happiness. What are your thoughts on this?
questions.suggestion:
• Tell me about a time when you wanted something but couldn't have it.

There was a time when I wanted something but couldnt have it. It was my friend's birthday. At that time we were only 7 years old. Her family was wealthy and she received a lot of gifts on her birthday, which included a very costly teddy bear. I was really jealous of her since i couldnt afford one, but fortunately, she was kind enough to let me play with her teddy bear once in a while. At that time, I thought that when I grow up, I will buy everything I used to desire as a child.

  • How did you feel about it?

As a kid, I felt envious of anyone who had something that I couldn’t afford. I also felt 

self-pity and upset a lot when I didn’t own a teddy bear. However, I would soon forget about those desperate and gloomy feelings after a few days. I was also glad and grateful that my friend let me play with that teddy bear. 

  • Material prossessions can't bring happiness. What are your thoughts on this?

I partly agree with this idea for various reasons. On the one hand, people desire a lot of material possessions. For instance, some yearn for new clothes, so they go shopping; some want to eat scrumptious dishes, so they work hard to afford it. However, material possessions can't always bring us happiness. In fact, they cannot bring us quality time with our loved ones, they cannot always strengthe our relationships. Overall, I think whether material possessions can bring happiness or not depends on what one defines happiness as.

subQuestion.content: Describe the way you went to the exam room.
subQuestion.suggestion: I left home early, so I had a lot of time. I took a taxi to the exam place. When I got there, I followed the signs to find the exam room. I took a few deep breaths to relax because I was a bit nervous. Then I checked my watch to make sure I wasn't late. I walked down the hall, found my exam room, and went inside feeling ready and focused.

subQuestion.content: Tell me about your country’s weather.
subQuestion.suggestion: In Northern Vietnam, there are four seasons: spring, summer, autumn, and winter. In the South, it has 2 seasons: dry season and rainy season. Now, I am living in the North so I experience four seasons in a year. In summer, it is so hot. By contrast, it is very cold in winter.

subQuestion.content: What is your favorite film? Why?
subQuestion.suggestion: CÔNG THỨC : I love all kinds of ... such as .... but if I had to choose one, I would go for ....I often .... with my friends on weekends. We also like talking about it when we chat online. It helps me ....

questions.questionTitle: Speaking - Công viên giải trí - Part 2

subQuestion.content: Describe this picture?
subQuestion.suggestion:
In the picture, I can see many people (số lượng): men, women, the old (người già) and children. They are walking on the street (đang đi bộ trên đường). After them, I see a lot of tall buildings. 

This picture reminds me of my family. Every day, my parents and I get up at 6 a.m…(tiếp một ngày của mình).

subQuestion.content: A time when you were in a crowded place
subQuestion.suggestion:
(dùng hoàn toàn thì hiện tại đơn ok nhé).

A time when I were in a crowded place was/is 1 month ago. It is a concert near Hoan Kiem Lake . There are so many people here (có quá nhiều người ở đây). I go there with my friends: Nam, Huy, Ngoc,… 

Để kéo dài thời gian ở đây chúng ta có 2 cách:

Cách 1: Kể về các friends của mình.

Nam is the oldest (Nam là người lớn tuổi nhất). He is 27 years old. He is handsome… (lần lượt mô tả những người bạn của mình cho đến khi hết thời gian).

Cách 2: Kể về một ngày của mình.

On that day, I get up at 6 a.m. I do morning exercises until 7 a.m. After that, I have breakfast at 8 a.m. At 9 a.m, I drive a car to work. At 11 a.m, I have lunch with my friends/ colleagues (đồng nghiệp). At 1 p.m, I come back to the office for work (tôi quay lại văn phòng để làm việc). I work until 5 p.m. I go to the gym. At 7 p.m, I come back home. At 8 p.m, I have a date with my girlfriend. We have dinner together and go to see a movie. At 11 p.m, I go to bed.

subQuestion.content: Why people not like crowded places ?
subQuestion.suggestion:
There are many reasons (câu muôn thuở khi được hỏi Why) why people don’t like crowed places. 

People do not like crowded places because of many reasons. 

First, I think they don’t like crowed places because of their privacy (sự riêng tư). Some introverted people don’t like going to the places where they can meet their relations (một số người hướng nội không thích đến những nơi mà họ có thể gặp những người quen của họ). 

Second, after Covid-19 , people tend to avoid going to crowded places. (sau dịch covid 19, con người có xu hướng tránh đến những nơi đông người). 

Third, recently (gần đây), crowded places can cause accidents (Iteawon).

questions.questionTitle: Speaking - Công viên giải trí - Part 3
questions.content: 45s/câu trả lời - trả lời từng câu

subQuestion.content: Tell me what you see in the two pictures.
subQuestion.suggestion:
Giống: Both pictures show me about sports. 

Khác: The differences between the two pictures are:

In the first picture, I can see 4 people. They are sitting in wheelchairs. They are playing basketball. They are wearing blue and black T-shirts. I see many people in basketball court (sân bóng rổ).

But in the second picture, I can see 4 people: 2 men and 2 women. They are shaking hands (bắt tay). They are in outdoor tennis court (sân tennis ngoài trời). I also see a coconut tree. 

Thích tranh nào hơn:  I prefer picture 1 because I like basketball.

subQuestion.content: Benifits of indoor and outdoor sports?
subQuestion.suggestion:
Both indoor and outdoor sports have benefits.  

Indoor sports seem to be safer (an toàn hơn) than outdoor sports. People can play games all the time regardless of (bất chấp)/ in bad weather (con người có thể chơi thể thao mọi lúc bất chấp thời tiết xấu). For example, playing football under the hard sunshine can make people ill. Rain can stop people from playing games outdoor. 

Outdoor sports make people closer to nature (gần gũi với thiên nhiên hơn). Playing voleyball at the beach or playing basketball in the outdoor court are very interesting.

subQuestion.content: Playing a game is to win. What do you think ?
subQuestion.suggestion:
I don’t completely agree with this opinion. In a way, playing a game is to win but sometimes people play games for relaxing. It helps reduce stress after a tiring day. Playing games also helps people get to know each other better.

CHƯA HẾT THỜI GIAN: Chúng ta có thể kể về trải nghiệm của bản thân.

Ex: I am a 25 years old man. I am single. I like football very much. On weekends, my friends and I always go to the football court to play football. My team has 7 people: Long, Quang, Huy, Tien,… They are handsome. They are single. They can cook very well…

questions.questionTitle: Speaking - Công viên giải trí - Part 4
questions.content:
2 phút/ 3 câu - trả lời liên tục

  1. A time you went to an amusement park?
  2. How do you feel?
  3. Rides in amusement parks is scary. What do you think?
questions.suggestion:
• A time you went to an amusement park? (Nhìn thấy câu hỏi có time mình phải mỉm cười và thấy dễ dàng vượt qua). 

A time I went/ go to an amusement park is last week. I go to Sun World/ Vinpearl Land Water Park with my friends. We have 5 people: Linh, Thuy, Lan, Loan, Huy. 

- Đến đây có thể kể về những người bạn của mình hoặc 1 ngày đi chơi công viên của mình như nào nhé (giống ngày bình thường thay go to work = go to amusement park thôi)


  • How do you feel ?

I feel so excited (hào hứng) at that time. It is the first time that I try water-skiing. I am also very happy because I can hang out with my best friends after a long time. 


  • Rides in amusement parks is scary. What do you think?

I don’t completely agree with this opinion. I think it depends on each person (tôi nghĩ nó phục thuộc vào từng người). Some people love the adventure (một số người ưa trải nghiệm). They may find riding in amusement parks so exciting (Họ có thể cảm thấy việc chơi trò chơi ở công viên giải trí rất thú vị). But for me, I am not brave so riding in amusement parks is not for me. (Nhưng đối với tôi, tôi không phải một người dũng cảm nên trò đó không dành cho tôi.)

subQuestion.content: Tell me about your childhood home.
subQuestion.suggestion:
*TRONG:

  • Mấy tầng/ loại nhà nào (The place where I live is a 4 -storey house in Hanoi City.).
  • Gồm những phòng nào (It has 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and a living room.).
  • Sơn màu gì (Every room is painted white and fully - equipped with a sofa, an air conditioner, and a ceiling light.)

*NGOÀI:

  • Xung quanh nhà (Around my house, there are many trees and tall buildings/ flowers. There is a market nearby so I can buy everything easily.)
  • Hàng xóm: My neighbors are friendly/noisy. We often have meals together and it’s very funny.

subQuestion.content: Describe something you are planning to do in the future.
subQuestion.suggestion: Giống PLACE (biến hoá nhẹ chút): In the future, I am planning to travel to .... It is famous for its wild beauty and many coffee shops. Thời tiết (The weather is so nice and cool.). Con người (The people there are very kind and friendly) and Đồ ăn (the food/ cuisine is so delicious). Giá cả (Plus, everything there is cheap/ expensive). I am really excited whenever I think about that trip.

subQuestion.content: Which dish is your favorite to cook?
subQuestion.suggestion: I love (cooking) many dishes such as fried chicken, Pho or beef noodles but If I had to choose one, I would go for fried eggs. It is very easy to make. I often eat it for breakfast and sometimes for lunch and dinner. It is tasty/yummy/delicious when going with chili sauce.

subQuestion.content: Describe this picture.
subQuestion.suggestion: In the picture, there are seven people in an office room. They are all office workers of a company. The six people sitting around the table may be employees, while the man standing is the boss. Those four women are all wearing blue or white shirts, while the two other men are wearing polite suits. On the table, there are many laptops and tablets, as well as cups of coffee or water. The boss may be bringing up plans or ideas for the next campaigns of the company during the meeting, while his employees are listening intentively. The office looks nice, with glass doors, a window and a white board or maybe a projector.

subQuestion.content: Tell us about the time you give a presentation. How did you feel?
subQuestion.suggestion: When I got into high school, we were given a presentation as our homework. It was the first time I had a presentation, so I was so nervous talking to a classroom of people about a topic that should interest people. My teacher let the class do a presentation on absolutely anything they wanted. I first chose to present about Animal Assisted Therapy. In the end, the class liked my presentation and I felt proud of myself. My teacher even used my PowerPoint as an example for his other classes. For someone who hates public speaking, this was a memorable experience with a presentation for me.

subQuestion.content: Why are people scared of public speaking ?
subQuestion.suggestion: The most common reason why people are scared when it comes to presenting or speaking in public is the fear of failing or self-doubt. Also, people get nervous when speaking in public because of the fear of being judged or making mistakes. All of these factors can cause our body to react in various ways, including increased heart rate, a dry mouth, and trembling.

questions.content: 45s/câu trả lời - trả lời từng câu

subQuestion.content: Tell me what you see in the two pictures.

The father is wearing a green shirt, while the mother is wearing a checkered shirt. She looks outstanding with her brown curly hair, which is beautiful. The father is colling his wife, and the siblings are standing next to each other, smiling happily. They are pulling a shopping cart filled with bread, bananas, pineapples,.... On both sides of the picture, I can see two aisles of groceries that look colorful.

Behind her, there is a curtain with a strawberry pattern, which looks so adorable and well painted. She may be at a local fair.

subQuestion.content: Benefits of markets and supermarkets ?
subQuestion.suggestion: • I think both have different strengths but contribute to a common purpose. The public market is important in a community as it facilitates social connection and provides amenities that encourage people to get closer. It is also more accessible in rural areas. In supermarkets, there is always a discount on products. Also, in supermarkets, it is still possible to find fresh and quality products. There is a playground for kids and a car park zone, so you don't need to worry about your kids and your car.

subQuestion.content: Why do many people not like shopping ?
subQuestion.suggestion: There are several reasons why some people may not enjoy shopping. For some, it could be due to a dislike of crowded spaces, long lines, or the stress of making decisions. Others may find shopping overwhelming or time-consuming. Additionally, some people may have financial concerns or simply prefer to spend their time on other activities.

  1. Tell me about a time you spent a lot of effort doing something.
questions.suggestion:
• Tell me about a time you spent a lot of effort doing something.

At that point, I was a senior student and like all the other students, passing the University entrance exam to get into my dream University was my main goal. But for me, I felt that the pressure was even higher since I had chosen Hanoi Medical University – one of the top Universities in Vietnam. In order to compete with the other candidates, every day I would spend hours in the library to read as many books as possible and to learn as much as I could. And even after school, I usually stayed up late to review everything I had learnt that day. It was a long process with a lot of hard work but in the end, I passed the entrance exam with outstanding results and became a medical student. When I received the results, I was so happy.

The woman has short hair and is wearing a grey pijama, while the man is wearing a red shirt and beige pants. Plus, they seem to be very concentrated as the man is hanging a picture on the wall. I think they are in a living room. The space is quite large. In the picture, I can see many picture frames on the floor and on the wall. I love this picture at first sight because it reminds me of some wonderful moments with my family.

subQuestion.content: Tell me about a time you decorated your house.
subQuestion.suggestion: • Last fall, I decided to decorate my house for Halloween. I hung up spooky spider webs on the porch and placed carved pumpkins with candles inside them by the front steps. Inside, I put up paper bats on the walls and arranged colorful autumn leaves on the dining table. The house felt festive and ready for trick-or-treaters. That night, as kids came by in their costumes, their smiles made all the effort worth it.

subQuestion.content: In modern life, people pay more attention to home decoration than in the past. Do you agree?
subQuestion.suggestion: • Yes, I agree that in modern life, people tend to pay more attention to home decoration than in the past. Because with the rise of social media platforms like Instagram, Pinterest, and YouTube, people have more access to home decor ideas and trends. This exposure inspires them to decorate their living spaces. Also, people view their homes as an expression of their personalities and like to decorate them in ways that reflect their tastes and lifestyles.

subQuestion.content: Which one do you prefer: eating out or eating at home?
subQuestion.suggestion: • Personally, I prefer eating at home because it's  healthier, cheaper, and I can have more control over ingredients and portion sizes. Additionally, eating at home provides a comfortable and personalized dining environment, often fostering family bonding and relaxation. Also, eating out is often more expensive and unhygienic.

subQuestion.content: Why do people prefer eating out to eating at home?
subQuestion.suggestion: • People prefer eating out to eating at home for many reasons. Firstly, it is more convenient and time-saving because they don’t have to spend time preparing ingredients, cooking and cleaning up afterward. Also, it provides an opportunity to try new and diverse cuisines, and allows people to socialize and experience different settings

questions.content:
2 phút/ 3 câu - trả lời liên tục

  1. Tell me about a time you traveled somewhere?
  2. How did you feel before the trip?
  3. People spend more and more money on traveling?
questions.suggestion:
Tell me about a time you traveled somewhere?

  • Last summer, I traveled to the beach with my family. We packed our car with swimsuits, towels, and a cooler full of snacks. After a few hours of driving, we arrived and were greeted by the sound of crashing waves and the smell of salty air. We spent the day building sandcastles, collecting seashells, and swimming in the ocean. As the sun set, we enjoyed a picnic on the sand, watching the sky turn pink and orange. It was a perfect day, full of fun and relaxation, and we all felt happy and refreshed on the drive back home.

How did you feel before the trip?

  • Before the trip, I felt excited and a little bit anxious. I was looking forward to the adventure and spending time with my family, but I also wanted everything to go smoothly. The anticipation of the fun activities we had planned and the beauty of the beach made me feel very excited and over the moon.

People spend more and more money on traveling?

  • People spend more and more money on traveling for several reasons. First, there's a trend of valuing experiences over money. Therefore, many people prioritize creating memories with their families and friends and gaining new experiences by traveling. Also, advances in transportation like airlines or metro, and many available travel options have made it easier and more affordable for people to visit many destinations around the world.

subQuestion.suggestion: • In the picture, I can see four people working in an office. There are three women and a woman, to be more specific. They are all wearing casual clothes and sitting around a wooden table, on which there are office documents, laptops and a computer. Everyone is working on their laptops and computer attentively and productively. The room looks spacious with a white wall hung with beautiful pictures and a big window overlooking the street. I like this picture because it shows perfectly the working environment of an office worker on a daily basis.

subQuestion.content: Tell me about a time when you did some work.
subQuestion.suggestion: • During my student life, I participated in numerous teamwork projects, and having disagreements with other team members was unavoidable. I would like to talk about a team project that I was involved in during the junior year at university. There were two of us on the team, and our task was to invest in the simulation stock market. Each group’s performance would be compared weekly, and at the end of the semester, we would have to present our project in front of the whole class. Despite our arguments, we completed the task on time and had an excellent group presentation. From this experience, I learned that it is very hard to be a good team member. You would have to know how to present yourself while fitting in the group and each person has to compromise to achieve a common goal.

subQuestion.content: Why is it important for people to enjoy their work?
subQuestion.suggestion: • Yes, it is extremely important to love what you do since liking your job will help you succeed. Being happy at work and loving what you do is an overall productivity booster and enhances performance. People who enjoy their jobs are more likely to be optimistic, motivated, learn faster, and make better business decisions.In contrast, unhappiness can cause stress, lower your immune system, and have a range of psychological effects such as prolonged depression and anxiety.

questions.suggestion:
A time when you asked a question

  • There are uncountable occasions when you have to raise a question to someone. But I specifically remember a time when I asked my professor about a topic that we had to do a presentation about but I didn’t have much knowledge about it. So I did ask him a number of questions related to the topic and I was so pleased that he was extremely enthusiastic about explaining all the notions to me and even gave me some reference documents to read. This helped me to have a deeper insight into the topic and did an excellent job with my presentation.

﻿

How you feel

  • felt honored and grateful to be taught by such an eminent intellectual and happy that I can broaden my knowledge about a completely new field. At first, I felt a bit ashamed for not having a sufficient knowledge of the topic, but I thought no one knew anything, so asking for my tutor’s help was the best decision.


Some subjects are too difficult for most people to understand. What do you think?

  • I think it is completely normal to not understand a certain subject that contains many sophisticated notions and theories. The fact that some subjects are difficult to comprehend may depend on a variety of reasons. It may be because of different academic capacities or one’s interest and enthusiasm in the subject. For example, some may find maths difficult to understand but have a knack for music and arts, and vice versa. And people can not change the nature of such subjects, but we have to do research to acquire better knowledge about that subject, or simply pursue what they are more interested in or better at.

The time I had many choices was when I chose to go to universities. Because of their high achievements the schools I chose are all top schools. My relatives gave me advice on getting into many universities. At that time, I found it extremely difficult to choose.

Thời điểm tôi có nhiều sự lựa chọn là khi tôi chọn vào đại học. Vì thành tích cao nên các trường tôi chọn đều là những trường top đầu. Người thân của tôi đã cho tôi lời khuyên để vào được nhiều trường đại học. Lúc đó tôi thấy việc lựa chọn vô cùng khó khăn.

I feel extremely confused, worried, and difficult to make the right choice

Tôi cảm thấy vô cùng bối rối, lo lắng, khó đưa ra lựa chọn đúng đắn


Do we have so many choices to make?

Yes. When we do something, we have many ways. Each person will have different choices and it will lead to a different result. - Đúng. Khi chúng ta làm một việc gì đó, chúng ta có nhiều cách. Mỗi người sẽ có những lựa chọn khác nhau và sẽ dẫn đến một kết quả khác nhau.

 At home waiting for my exam scores when my mom called me to inform me that the results had come out. I was on pins and needles, my hands were shaking. I nervously typed my name on the highschool website to look for my scores. Fortunately, I managed to pass the entrance exam.

questions.content:
2 phút/ 3 câu - trả lời liên tục

  1. The last time you met a person of the older or younger generation?
  2. How did you feel?
  3. What lessons did each generation give you?
questions.suggestion:
1. The last time you met a person of the older or younger generation?

2. How did you feel?

3. What lessons did each generation give you?

Learning from older people is like finding a box of important life lessons. They've been through a lot, and their stories have really useful things to teach us. They show us how to keep going even when things are tough, remind us to be kind to others, and tell us that it's okay to take our time in life. Learning from older people is more than just learning facts; it's like getting a guide to understand life better and use their lessons to make our future brighter.

We can learn a lot from younger people. They know about the newest stuffs, like cool gadgets and trends, and that helps us stay connected. Young folks are full of energy and have great ideas. They teach us to be open-minded and find new ways to solve problems. They also show us how important it is to include everyone, no matter where they're from or what they're like. Learning from younger people is like adding fun and excitement to our lives.

questions.questionTitle: Speaking - RECEIVING AN EMAIL (NHẬN ĐƯỢC EMAIL HOẶC THÔNG BÁO) - Part 2

subQuestion.content: Describe the picture.
subQuestion.suggestion:
In the picture, I see many people.

This picture is about an exhibition - a room showing/ displaying many pictures, it is so large/big with many pictures on the wall. I see many people there. They are walking and looking at the picture. They are also talking about those pictures. I am impressed by - I really like the two women standing closest to me. They are middle-aged but still beautiful. This picture reminds me of my grandmother. She likes exhibitions a lot.

Trong bức ảnh, tôi thấy nhiều người.

Bức tranh này nói về một cuộc triển lãm - một căn phòng trưng bày/trưng bày nhiều bức tranh, nó rất lớn với nhiều bức tranh trên tường. Tôi thấy nhiều người ở đó. Họ đang đi bộ và nhìn vào bức tranh. Họ cũng đang nói về những bức tranh đó. Tôi ấn tượng bởi - Tôi thực sự thích hai người phụ nữ đứng gần tôi nhất. Họ đã ở độ tuổi trung niên nhưng vẫn đẹp. Hình ảnh này làm tôi nhớ đến bà tôi. Bà rất thích triển lãm.

subQuestion.content: Tell me the last time you visited the exhibition.
subQuestion.suggestion:
The last time I visited the exhibition was last week. It was in a museum near my house. I went there with my friends. We were all excited about the pictures. The topic is “Fight for Women”. On that day, we… (cut 1 phần trong một ngày của mình, thay chủ ngữ “I” thành “we”)

Lần cuối cùng tôi đến thăm triển lãm là vào tuần trước. Nó nằm trong viện bảo tàng gần nhà tôi. Tôi đã đến đó với bạn bè của tôi. Tất cả chúng tôi đều vui mừng về những bức ảnh. Chủ đề là "Đấu tranh cho phụ nữ".

subQuestion.content: Why do people like those pictures/exhibitions?
subQuestion.suggestion:
People like exhibitions for various reasons.

First, people enjoy exhibitions because they provide a unique opportunity to learn something new, whether it’s about history, art, or outer space,…

Second, exhibitions are designed to be appealing/ attractive to stimulate all senses.

Finally, people may attend exhibitions to support their favorite artists.

Mọi người thích triển lãm vì nhiều lý do.

Đầu tiên, mọi người thích triển lãm vì chúng mang đến cơ hội duy nhất để học hỏi điều gì đó mới mẻ, cho dù đó là về lịch sử, nghệ thuật, không gian bên ngoài,…

Thứ hai, triển lãm được thiết kế hấp dẫn/hấp dẫn để kích thích mọi giác quan.

Cuối cùng, mọi người có thể tham dự các cuộc triển lãm để hỗ trợ các nghệ sĩ yêu thích của họ.

questions.questionTitle: Speaking - RECEIVING AN EMAIL (NHẬN ĐƯỢC EMAIL HOẶC THÔNG BÁO) - Part 3
questions.content: 45s/câu trả lời - trả lời từng câu

subQuestion.content: Describe the 2 picture.
subQuestion.suggestion:
*GIỐNG:

Both pictures show me people’s lives.

*KHÁC:

Cách 1: tả tranh 1, tả tranh 2

Regarding the differences, in the first picture… and in the second picture…

Cách 2:

The differences between the 2 pictures are:

In the first picture,…

But in the second picture,…

* THÍCH BỨC TRANH NÀO HƠN: I prefer picture 1 or 2 because ….

subQuestion.content: Do you prefer living alone or living with your family?
subQuestion.suggestion:
+ Living with family:

- Living with my family is so comfortable cause I don’t need to care too much about electricity bills, water bills and living costs (tiền nhà). My mom cooks for me.

- Living with my family makes me feel like the luckiest person in the world. Every member shares with me a lot about work and life. I am always supported when I need someone besides me.

+ Living alone:

- Living alone makes me feel like I am leading an independent life. I have to work as hard as I can to be rich/ buy everything I need/want. I must be stronger.

- Living alone, I can do anything I want, I stay up too late and chat/ text with my friends. I can go out at midnight.

Sometimes, I feel blue and alone, I want to come back home and hug my parents.

+ Sống cùng gia đình:

- Sống với gia đình tôi rất thoải mái vì tôi không cần quan tâm quá nhiều đến tiền điện, tiền nước và chi phí sinh hoạt (tiền nhà). Mẹ tôi nấu ăn cho tôi.

- Được sống cùng gia đình khiến tôi cảm thấy mình là người may mắn nhất thế giới. Mọi thành viên đều chia sẻ với tôi rất nhiều về công việc và cuộc sống. Tôi luôn được hỗ trợ khi tôi cần ai đó bên cạnh.

+ Sống độc thân:

- Sống một mình khiến tôi có cảm giác mình đang sống một cuộc sống tự lập. Tôi phải làm việc chăm chỉ nhất có thể để trở nên giàu có/ mua mọi thứ tôi cần/muốn. Tôi phải mạnh mẽ hơn.

- Sống một mình, tôi có thể làm bất cứ điều gì tôi muốn, tôi thức khuya và trò chuyện/nhắn tin với bạn bè. Tôi có thể ra ngoài lúc nửa đêm.

Đôi khi, tôi cảm thấy buồn và cô đơn, tôi muốn trở về nhà và ôm bố mẹ tôi.

subQuestion.content: Is it necessary for young people to live independently from their families?
subQuestion.suggestion:
Đọc lại câu hỏi + cụm kéo dài time + The answer is…

The answer is Yes. Living independently can be a valuable experience for personal growth. It helps people learn important skills like finance management, time management,…

Although living with family may be beneficial for young people’s mental and emotional well-being, they need to know how to take care of themselves because in the future, they will be parents.

Câu trả lời là Có. Sống độc lập có thể là một trải nghiệm quý giá cho sự phát triển cá nhân. Nó giúp mọi người học các kỹ năng quan trọng như quản lý tài chính, quản lý thời gian,…

Mặc dù sống cùng gia đình có thể có lợi cho sức khỏe tinh thần và tình cảm của những người trẻ tuổi, nhưng họ cần biết cách chăm sóc bản thân vì trong tương lai, họ sẽ làm cha mẹ.

questions.questionTitle: RECEIVING AN EMAIL (NHẬN ĐƯỢC EMAIL HOẶC THÔNG BÁO)
questions.content:
Tell me a time you received an email or a notification.

Which do you use to receive that email or notification?

A lot of people think that information is available these days. What do you think?
questions.suggestion:
Chia time 1p40-10-10

1. Tell me a time you received an email or a notification.

First, The last time I received an email was last night. At 11 p.m., I got an email/message from my boss about a job/work/a deadline/ a task. At that time, I was brushing my teeth before sleeping. (buổi tối) Before that, I had dinner at 7 pm. Then I watched TV at 8 p.m. I read a book at 9 p.m….

Đầu tiên, Lần cuối cùng tôi nhận được một email là vào đêm qua. Lúc 11 giờ đêm, tôi nhận được email/tin nhắn từ sếp về công việc/công việc/thời hạn/nhiệm vụ. Lúc đó tôi đang đánh răng trước khi ngủ. (buổi tối) Trước đó, tôi ăn tối lúc 7 giờ tối. Sau đó, tôi xem TV lúc 8 giờ tối. Tôi đọc một cuốn sách lúc 9 giờ tối….

2. Which do you use to receive that email or notification?

Second, When I received that email, I was using my 14 pro max, which is a smartphone from Apple/ laptop. I used it from 6 p.m to 11 p.m.

Thứ hai, khi tôi nhận được email đó, tôi đang sử dụng chiếc 14 pro max, một chiếc điện thoại thông minh của Apple/máy tính xách tay. Tôi đã sử dụng nó từ 6 giờ chiều đến 11 giờ tối.

3. A lot of people think that information is available these days. What do you think? 

Đọc lại câu hỏi + Cụm kéo dài thời gian

Finally, I don’t completely agree with this statement/opinion. I do think nowadays, it is easy to get information/news in the world/every aspect/field. But, we need to search for them. We need a laptop or a computer or a phone to do that. So I don’t think information is available. 

Cuối cùng, tôi không hoàn toàn đồng ý với nhận định/ý kiến này. Tôi nghĩ ngày nay, thật dễ dàng để có được thông tin/tin tức trên thế giới/mọi khía cạnh/lĩnh vực. Nhưng, chúng ta cần phải tìm kiếm chúng. Chúng ta cần một máy tính xách tay hoặc máy tính hoặc điện thoại để làm điều đó. Vì vậy, tôi không nghĩ rằng thông tin có sẵn.

items.title: Làm đồ vật gì đó mất nhiều công sức

subQuestion.content: Describe the room you are in.
subQuestion.suggestion:
CON NGƯỜI: In this room, I can see many people: 3 teachers (examiners/ supervisors) and 20 students (examinees, test takers). The teachers look very serious, they are walking around to make sure everything runs smoothly. The students look very confident.

KHÔNG GIAN: The room is quite large/ small.

ĐỒ VẬT: I can see many computers and headsets on desks for candidates.

subQuestion.content: Please tell me about the last thing you saw on television.
subQuestion.suggestion: (WHAT) The last thing I saw on TV was a movie. (HOW) It was interesting. (HOW OFTEN) I watch TV twice a week at home on weekends. (WHEN) In the evening, after dinner, I open the TV and watch with my mom (WHO). That movie was great and we felt over the moon (HOW). It helps me reduce stress after a long day. (LỢI ÍCH)

subQuestion.suggestion: I love (cooking) many dishes such as fried chicken, Pho or beef noodles but If I had to choose one, I would go for fried eggs. It is very easy to make. I often eat it for breakfast and sometimes for lunch and dinner. It is tasty/yummy/delicious when going with chili sauce.

questions.questionTitle: Speaking - LẦN LÀM ĐỒ VẬT GÌ ĐÓ MẤT NHIỀU CÔNG SỨC - Part 2

subQuestion.content: Describe the picture.
subQuestion.suggestion:
*Người: In the foreground, I can see 2 people who are playing football. I guess they are a father and a son. They look so comfortable in their casual clothes. In particular, the dad is wearing sunglasses and the son is wearing a blue T-shirt and red shoes. They seem to be very excited.

*Vật: In the background, there are many trees and the green grassland. Maybe, it is a park, I think. The weather is nice and sunny. 

I love this picture at first sight because it reminds me of some wonderful memories with my dad when I was little.

subQuestion.content: Tell me the last time you did an outdoor activity.
subQuestion.suggestion: As a final year student, I am very busy right now so I don’t have time for any activities. But if I remember correctly, it was last year. My friends and I went to an amusement park after being on the fence about where to go. It was a nice place. There are many trees and people are friendly. We had planned to meet for weeks, but my friends who are doctors were busy so it was easier said than done. We spent 3 hours there doing a lot of activities: playing games, camping and singing. That time was so great and we all felt over the moon.

subQuestion.content: Why should people do outdoor activities?
subQuestion.suggestion: There are many reasons why people do outdoor activities. Firstly, it helps people clear their heads and forget all the pressures from their work after a long hard time. Secondly, it is also a great way for them to exercise and improve their health. Thirdly, when doing outdoor activities with their family and friends, they get the chance to maintain healthy relationships with people they love.

questions.questionTitle: Speaking - LẦN LÀM ĐỒ VẬT GÌ ĐÓ MẤT NHIỀU CÔNG SỨC - Part 3
questions.content: 45s/câu trả lời - trả lời từng câu

subQuestion.content: Tell me what you see in the two photographs.
subQuestion.suggestion:
Giống: The two pictures are related to riding animals. Both of them look very colorful and exciting.

*Khác: However, there are also some differences between them.

In the first picture, I can see a woman who is riding a horse. I guess she is a professional jockey or maybe she is a tourist. She looks gorgeous and with long hair. Likewise, there is one man in the second photo, he seems to be a local person with traditional clothes.

The picture on the left shows a flower field in the background. Besides, the weather is so nice and sunny.

By contrast, the picture on the right shows a desert and the weather is so hot and extreme.

*Cảm nhận: I am impressed by the first one because it reminds me of some wonderful memories.

subQuestion.content: Have you ever ridden a horse or a camel before?
subQuestion.suggestion: No, I haven’t. I haven’t had any chance to try that experience but I think one day when I save up enough money, I would buy a flight ticket and go to Egypt so that I could try riding a camel. And, I would go there with some of my friends, I think, who share similar interests with me. We would take a lot of photos and post them on Instagram and make as many TikTok videos as we can, I promise.

subQuestion.content: Should people use animals to commute?
subQuestion.suggestion: I think, not. I mean in some countries where people don’t have transportation, modern vehicles, it is ok and acceptable. But in some countries where people have cars bikes and motorbikes, using animals as vehicles is inhumane. Personally, I think so. They need to be protected, fed, and taken care of. However, some of my friends think that riding animals as a way to commute is good for the environment because it helps reduce CO2 emissions

questions.questionTitle: Speaking - LẦN LÀM ĐỒ VẬT GÌ ĐÓ MẤT NHIỀU CÔNG SỨC - Part 4
questions.content:
2 phút/ 3 câu - trả lời liên tục

  1. The last time you made something by yourself that took a lot of effort? 
  2. How did you feel when you finished it?
  3. People should make as many items as they can instead of buying them. Do you agree?
questions.suggestion:
The last time you made something by yourself that took a lot of effort? 

I can’t remember exactly but I guess I was 20 years ago when I was a student in primary school. There was one subject called crafts, I think. And, the teacher told us to make our own wooden house. It was my very first time doing it so I was quite unsure and not ready. After hearing instructions from my teacher and with the help of my classmates, I started to do it. And it turned out that making a wooden house is not that difficult. I finally managed to finish my own house. My friends and I continuously talked and laughed during the process. In the end, my teacher awarded a prize to three students who had the most beautiful houses and luckily I was one of them.


How did you feel when you finished it?

I think it was a sense of accomplishment and I also felt proud of myself because I always thought that I was bad at doing something like DIY stuff. But that experience totally changed my mind, I had the ability to make a wooden house. It was incredible. After the class, I ran home and showed my parents what I had made and they gave compliments to me. My “piece of work” is now being displayed in the living room of my childhood home and I think I will keep it forever.


People should make as many items as they can instead of buying them. Do you agree?

No, I don’t think so. I believe each person should focus on specializing their strengths. For example, those who are good at producing clothes should produce clothes and those who are good at growing vegetables should grow vegetables. That way, everyone can create income for themselves and value for society. We will sell what we produce well and buy what we cannot make ourselves. This is how the economy is and will continue to develop.

subQuestion.content: Please tell me about the last time you visited friends.
subQuestion.suggestion:
The last time I visited my friend was last weekend. She is wonderful and

kind. I visit (come over) my friend’s house once a week. We often had dinner

and went shopping together in the evening. That was very funny. We all felt

over the moon after that. Sometimes, I stay over at her house.

subQuestion.content: What is the food like in your country?
subQuestion.suggestion: I love (cooking) many dishes such as fried chicken, Pho or beef noodles but If I had to choose one, I would go for fried eggs. It is very easy to make. I often eat it for breakfast and sometimes for lunch and dinner. It is tasty/yummy/delicious when going with chili sauce.

subQuestion.content: Tell me about your country.
subQuestion.suggestion:
Giống PLACE (biến hoá nhẹ chút): My country has many beautiful places. Da Lat

City is an example. It is famous for its wild beauty and many coffee shops. The

weather is nice and cool. The people there are very kind and friendly and the food/

cuisine is so delicious. Plus, everything there is cheap/ expensive. People often go

to ... in the summer and autumn. All members of my family love this place.

subQuestion.content: Describe this picture.
subQuestion.suggestion:
• In this picture, we can see a girl / As you can see, there is a girl who is lying on a lawn.
  • I see frost on the grass. Maybe/... she goes out in the morning
  •  It is a sunny day
  • She is about 8 years old
  • Maybe she is wearing a gray/blue top, black jeans and shoes
  • I guess she is reading her favorite novel/comic

subQuestion.content: A time you feel relaxing...
subQuestion.suggestion: The last time I felt good is meeting my family/friends, ... after a working-hard day. In this time, we cooked together,.... (kể 1 vài hoạt động mà bạn hay làm trong khoảng thời gian đó, nêu cảm xúc của bạn)

subQuestion.content: The reason making relaxing be an important part in our life...
subQuestion.suggestion:
• Many people think that relaxing is an important part in our life and I totally agree with this opinion.
  • If we just work without relax day by day, our body will be stressed, and even, we can get one of serious medical symptoms such as depression (trầm cảm),... Tốt cho thể chất, tinh thần.

questions.content: Trả lời từng câu

subQuestion.content: Compare 2 pictures.
subQuestion.suggestion:
• Both 2 pictures are related to music
  • In the picture 1, there is only one person who is wearing headphones and lying on the sofa at home while there are 5 people performing in a concert in the picture 2.
  • In the picture 1, the woman is about 40 years-old, people are about 20 years old in the second one.
  • It seems peaceful in the picture 1. I guess that it is a rock band so it sounds noisy in the picture 2

subQuestion.content: The musical experiences in 2 pictures
subQuestion.suggestion:
• I think each picture will send us different experiences.
  • Maybe listening to music at home will make us feel relax and private.
  • In contrast, if you love noisy places, taking part in a concert will give you funny and amazing experiencess.

subQuestion.content: The reason for listening to music
subQuestion.suggestion:
• From my point of view/ In my mind/ In my opinion, there are a lot of reasons why we listen to music. 
  • lt's a good way to relax after a busy day. 
  • lt makes us love our life more.
  • Furthermore/Moreover, many music events can connect everyone together...

questions.content:
2 phút/ 3 câu - trả lời liên tục

  1. Q1+ 2 ,.A time you met someone and your feeling...
  2. Q3 ,.The best thing when we meet someone new...
questions.suggestion:
Q1+ 2 ,.A time you met someone and your feeling...(Hãy kể về một lần bạn gặp 1 ai đó).

  • The first time I met my best friend/my colleague/my boss/... was 10 years ago/ last week/.... I can't remember exactly what we did in this meeting but it's an amazing memory.
  •  In my mind, she is a long black hair girl with shining smile. I'm a low key, so she is the one who talking first. From this meeting, we are best friend till now.

3. The best thing when we meet someone new... (Chúng ta nhận được những lợi ích tốt đẹp nào khi gặp gỡ những người bạn mới?)

  • With me/ From my point of view/ In my opinion,... each person we met would give us a lot of good things, and they are not the same.
  • Each meeting can give you a good friend, amazing colleagues, or a wonderful chance to get an important relationship for your work. And I think we should feel grateful for them.

subQuestion.content: Please tell me about your family.
subQuestion.suggestion:
(Số thành viên, gồm ai) My family has ... people: my dad, my mom, my sister

and me. (Nghề nghiệp & tuổi) My dad is a doctor and he is 60 years old, my

mom is a teacher and she is 50 years old. My sister is 30 years old and is a

nurse. I am a student and this year I am 20.

subQuestion.content: Please tell me about a famous place in your country.
subQuestion.suggestion:
Địa điểm nào (My favorite/ A famous place in my country is ... It is famous for its wild beauty and many

coffee shops/ modern structure/ up-to-date amenities.

Thời tiết (The weather is so nice and cool.),

Con người (The people there are very kind and friendly) and Đồ ăn (the food/ cuisine is so delicious).

Giá cả (Plus, everything there is cheap/ expensive). People often go to ... in the summer and autumn. All

members of my family love this place.

subQuestion.content: Tell me about your hobby.
subQuestion.suggestion:
I enjoy many hobbies such as watching films, reading books, listening to

music, playing sports, and going shopping. I often do what I love on

weekends and in my free time. For example, my mom and I go shopping

every Sunday. I prefer cartoons, rock and badminton.

subQuestion.content: Describe this picture
subQuestion.suggestion: Looking at the picture, I can see a girl standing on a bus. She has curly hair, and she is wearing glasses and a stripped T-shirt. She is holding onto a handle in order not to fall while the bus is moving. Behind her, there are many other passengers sitting. There is a man wearing glasses and a blue T-shirt, and there is another man wearing a pink tee. The bus looks spacious and clean. I also travel by bus on a weekly basis to go home.

subQuestion.content: Tell me about a time when you used public transport?
subQuestion.suggestion:
A time when I used public transport was last week. I went to Vung tau by train with my

sister. It took us two hours to get there. We swam on in the beach and ate seafoods there.

subQuestion.content: People should use public transport more. Do you agree? Why, or why not?
subQuestion.suggestion:
I agree that people should use public transport more. Because it is cheaper for people and

it can helps protect the nature. Moreover, public transport helps alleviate traffic congestion, leading to smoother traffic flow and reduced idling time for vehicles.

questions.content: Trả lời từng câu

subQuestion.content: Tell me what you see in the two pictures.
subQuestion.suggestion:
In the left photo, a teacher and two kids are looking at the vase and the painting on the wall. The children are wearing colorful clothes, while the teacher is wearing a formal black suit. They are listening attentively to what the teacher is saying. The teacher is pointing at the large photo of nature with trees, rocks and a river. The room is spacious and spotless, yet a little too dark.This picture reminds me of the time when I was in kindergarten.

In the right photo, a kid wearing a helmet is walking on a bridge. There are trees around. The little boy is wearing a white tee and blue jeans. He looks so excited and not scared at all when crossing that bridge. Behind him, there is a blue sky and trees, which is fresh and close to nature. I love this picture because I like to engage in outdoor activities.

subQuestion.content: What are the benefits for children doing these two activities?
subQuestion.suggestion:
When children go to museums, they can learn about the history or enjoy the art works.

However, when they go to the forest, they can enjoy the nature and learn how to protect it. Both activities are great, however, I like participating in outdoor activities to gain experience and train my body.

subQuestion.content: It is easier to learn something if you enjoy doing it. What do you think?
subQuestion.suggestion:
I agree that it is easier to learn something if you enjoy doing it. Because you will be more

active when learning and you can remember or understand it better. When we are interested in a topic, our brains are more engaged and motivated to learn. This can lead to increased focus, attention, and enjoyment, which in turn can make the learning process feel easier and faster.

questions.content:
2 phút/ 3 câu - trả lời liên tục

  1. Tell me about some of the different ways you use the internet?
  2. How do you feel when you use the internet?
  3. Some people think the internet has a bad impact on our lives. What do you think?
questions.suggestion:
- Tell me about some of the different ways you use the internet?

- How do you feel when you use the internet?

- Some people think the internet has a bad impact on our lives. What do you think?

Firstly, I often use the internet to type documents or search for information for my work. Besides, I listen to music or watch online films on the internet to relax. For me, the Internet is a flexible tool which helps me to better my study as well as unwind in my leisure time. The internet can also be used for online shopping from your house and get it delivered without leaving your house. 

Secondly, I feel great when I use the internet because it can help me do everything I want.

It is very useful for both my study and work. I also use the Internet for entertainment, so I feel relaxed and happy when using it. Ever since I started using the internet, I always feel at ease as it helps my life so much easier and more convenient.

I agree that the internet has a bad impact on our lives because if people spend too much

time playing online games, it can affect their eyes and posture. Besides, excessive time spent online can lead to decreased interpersonal skills and isolation, as people may prioritize virtual interactions over real-life relationships. It also leads to mental health issues since increased screen time has been linked to higher risks of depression, anxiety, and stress.

subQuestion.suggestion: I left home early, so I had a lot of time. I took a taxi to the exam place. When I got there, I followed the signs to find the exam room. I took a few deep breaths to relax because I was a bit nervous. Then I checked my watch to make sure I wasn't late. I walked down the hall, found my exam room, and went inside feeling ready and focused.

subQuestion.content: Tell me about your country’s weather.
subQuestion.suggestion: In Northern Vietnam, there are four seasons: spring, summer, autumn, and winter. In the South, it has 2 seasons: dry season and rainy season. Now, I am living in the North so I experience four seasons in a year. In summer, it is so hot. By contrast, it is very cold in winter.

subQuestion.suggestion: CÔNG THỨC : I love all kinds of ... such as .... but if I had to choose one, I would go for ....I often .... with my friends on weekends. We also like talking about it when we chat online. It helps me ....

On the table, they are served with plenty of delicious and mouth-watering dishes. This picture reminds me of times when I eat out with my friends. It was really fun.

subQuestion.content: Tell me the last time you went to a restaurant with your friends.
subQuestion.suggestion: The last time I went to a restaurant with my friends was last month. We were having hotpot for dinner. The meal was affordable and kinda scrumptious. However, the restaurant was a bit crowded and noisy since it was on the weekend. After that meal, we all went for ice cream and went jogging around the park near  there.

subQuestion.content: Why do people enjoy eating out with their friends?
subQuestion.suggestion: Sharing a meal is a fundamental human way to connect with others. It provides a relaxed setting for conversation, laughter, and catching up. This can help strengthen existing friendships and even foster new ones. Besides, eating out takes the pressure off of having to cook, clean, or plan a menu. It allows friends to relax and enjoy a change of scenery from their everyday routine.

questions.content: Trả lời từng câu

subQuestion.content: Tell me what you see in the two pictures.
subQuestion.suggestion:
• In the first picture, I can see a grown man carrying a packbag and a suitcase, looking out of the window. He is probably standing in the airport waiting for his flight.
  • In the second picture, there is another man standing near the railway, probably waiting for his train.

subQuestion.content: Which means of transport do you prefer? Why?
subQuestion.suggestion: I mean it depends on the distance. If it's a long way to go, I believe flying by plane is much faster. But if it’s a short distance, a flight might take more time for procedures than a train would. Besides, when traveling by train, it is relaxing to look out of the window enjoying the view outside.

subQuestion.content: Why do people usually not choose to travel by plane?
subQuestion.suggestion: • Plane tickets can be expensive, especially for long distances or during peak travel times. Besides, some people simply find the entire air travel experience unpleasant. This could include the hassle of security checks, cramped legroom in coach class, long delays, or the loss of control associated with being in a metal tube in the sky.

questions.content:
2 phút/ 3 câu - trả lời liên tục

  1. Tell me about a time when you achieved your goal.  
  2. How do you feel about it?  
  3. What do people need to do to achieve their goals?
questions.suggestion:
Tell me about a time when you achieved your goal.  

One of the biggest goals when I was younger was to pass the entrance exam to specialized highschool in my hometown. I had bent over backwards to achieve that dream. I remembered back to the time when I received the news that I passed the exam to my dream highschool. On that day, I was staying at home waiting for my exam scores when my mom called me to inform me that the results had come out. I was on pins and needles, my hands were shaking. I nervously typed my name on the highschool website to look for my scores. Fortunately, I managed to pass the entrance exam.


How do you feel about it?  

I was on cloud nine because I felt like all of my hard work had been paid off. I also felt extremely proud of myself for all the hard work and effort I have put in. 


What do people need to do to achieve their goals?  

I think they need to set clear goals first, with a clear timetable. After that, they need to be determined and stick to that timetable in order to achieve their dream.

subQuestion.content: Tell me about your childhood home.
subQuestion.suggestion:
*TRONG:

  • Mấy tầng/ loại nhà nào (The place where I live is a 4 -storey house in Hanoi City.).
  • Gồm những phòng nào (It has 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and a living room.).
  • Sơn màu gì (Every room is painted white and fully - equipped with a sofa, an air conditioner, and a ceiling light.)

*NGOÀI:

questions.content:
2 phút/ 3 câu - trả lời liên tục

  1. Have you ever saved up to buy something?
  2. How did you feel? 
  3. People spend too much money on unnecessary items. What do you think?
questions.suggestion:
1. Have you ever saved up to buy something?

  • I saved up to buy a laptop because I love it. It had many benefits like helping me study or work, access new technology.When I saved up I avoided spending on necessary and useless things.

Tôi tiết kiệm tiền để mua laptop vì tôi thích nó. Nó mang lại rất nhiều lợi ích như giúp tôi học tập, làm việc, tiếp cận công nghệ. Khi tôi tiết kiệm, tôi tránh chi tiêu vào những thứ cần thiết và vô ích.


     2. How did you feel? 

  • I'm certainly very happy and happy because I can buy what I want. At the same time, I know how to cherish that computer, do not damage
  • I feel proud of myself for learning how to save money

 Chắc chắn tôi rất vui và hạnh phúc vì có thể mua được thứ mình muốn, đồng thời, tôi biết trân trọng chiếc máy tính đó, không làm hư hỏng.

Tôi cảm thấy tự hào về bản thân vì đã học được cách tiết kiệm tiền

 3. People spend too much money on unnecessary items. What do you think? 

  • As a young person, I realize this is a common problem in society.
  • As society develops, human needs will increase. They invest in expensive forms of entertainment such as shopping and entertainment. There are clothes you buy and wear once. Even buy it for fun or go to a restaurant and order a lot of food just to take pictures and then waste it. Thereby causing financial loss
  • I'm sure they will be very miserable when they encounter urgent problems. This is the harmful of not knowing how to save


Là một người trẻ, tôi nhận thấy đây là vấn đề phổ biến trong xã hội.

Khi xã hội phát triển, nhu cầu của con người sẽ tăng lên. Họ đầu tư vào những hình thức giải trí đắt tiền như mua sắm, giải trí. Có những bộ quần áo bạn mua về và mặc một lần. Thậm chí mua cho vui hay vào nhà hàng gọi nhiều đồ ăn chỉ để chụp hình rồi lãng phí

Tôi tin chắc họ sẽ rất đau khổ khi gặp phải vấn đề cấp bách. Đây là tác hại của việc không biết tiết kiệm

Obviously I also enjoy watching movies and stuff in my free time, and I believe it isn’t a complete waste of time, since you also learn to work with other software programs, installing necessary drivers and overall it isn’t just as simple as hitting a button and watching a movie you want to watch. subQuestion.content: Do you think technology makes life eassier ?
subQuestion.suggestion: Technology makes life easier by automating tasks, reducing manual efforts, and enhancing efficiency. For example, household appliances like washing machines and dishwashers save time and effort in cleaning chores.

questions.questionTitle: Speaking - Xem tác phẩm nghệ thuật - Part 4
questions.content:
2 phút/ 3 câu - trả lời liên tục

  1. A time you saw an impressive work of art.
  2. How did it make you feel?
  3. It is impossible to teach people to be creative. Do you agree with this?
questions.suggestion:
A time you saw an impressive work of art

  • I was once given a chance to go to a Vangogh museum, where most of his masterpieces are the main theme of the event. I then came across the painting named "Wheat Field with Cypresses" by the renowned Dutch artist Vincent van Gogh.​​​​​​ What I find most captivating about this painting is its ability to evoke a profound sense of emotion. Van Gogh's use of bold colors and dynamic brushstrokes transmits a feeling of uncertainty and passion. It also reflects his turbulent mental state at the time. I am a big fan of Vangogh’s pieces of work, so that was such a wonderful experience for me.

How did it make you feel?

  • I feel extremely impressed by the art work and also sympathetic to his pitiful life. This painting gives me a deeper insight into his story and I feel emotionally attached to it.I also felt extremely inspired by his artworks to create my own as I can express my stories and emotions without putting them into words just like Vangogh.

It is impossible to teach people to be creative. Do you agree with this ?

  • No and yes. The degree of overall creativity a person has is certainly an inherent component of a person’s inborn personality. That being said, the idea of creativity itself is a many-sided thing for which many aspects can be taught; or, at the very least, can be improved upon.
