questions.questionTitle: Speaking -   BAO QUANH BỞI THIÊN NHIÊN - Part 2

subQuestion.content: Describe the picture.
subQuestion.suggestion: In the picture, I can see two women talking with each other. They must be best friends. The woman on the left has fair skin, and is wearing a red stripped shirt and blue jeans, while her friend, who is the woman on the right has brighter skin and she is wearing a light blue shirt and blue jeans. Both have long black hair, which is beautiful of them. They are sitting on a light green sofa with their legs crossed and holding yellow cups of hot coffee, maybe. They seem to be having a fun and interesting conversation together. I like this picture because it depicts perfectly how my friend and I often catch up with each other.

subQuestion.content: Tell me about the last time you had a heart-to-heart conversation with someone.
subQuestion.suggestion: The last meaningful conversation I had was with my friend, I was put in a position that if I didn’t do something, she would end her life as she has been suffering from depression for quite a long time. So I talked to her, I told her how important she is and how life would never be the same without her. We had a deep talk about the value of life and how to stay strong and combat difficulties when they encounter you. It was a meaningful talk with advice and genuine feelings that brought me so many life lessons and how to sympathize with others’ struggles. I appreciate any opportunity to have such conversation with my family and friends, especially when it helps us to express our feelings and be able to understand others’ situations.

subQuestion.content: Talking is the best way to solve problems. Do you agree with this opinion?
subQuestion.suggestion: I agree that most problems can be solved by talking when two or more parties are in agreement to work toward a resolution. Talking to people about things that upset you can be great. It can make you feel understood and give you good perspectives. By being sympathized and given good advice, you will be encouraged and empowered to come up with solutions to your own problems. Dealing with difficulties alone may dishearten you, but if you are able to share your struggles with someone, it would be much easier.

questions.questionTitle: Speaking -   BAO QUANH BỞI THIÊN NHIÊN - Part 3
questions.content: Trả lời từng câu

subQuestion.content: Tell me what you see in the two pictures.
subQuestion.suggestion:
• In the first picture, there is a man eating a whole table of food in the kitchen. He is wearing a red hoodie and holding a glass of coke and a crossant by both hands. He is gobbling up fast food and he seems to enjoy them so much. On the table, there are many dishes, namely cake, pizza, ice-cream, hamburger, and so on. Behind him are kitchen furniture with many cooking utensils hung on the wall.
  • In the second picture, I can see a man cooking in his kitchen. He is wearing a grey sweater and a brown apron in order not to blot his clothes. On the table, there are many cooking ingredients, most of them are vegetables, such as brocoli, bell pepers, tomatoes and carrots, and cooking oil. The man is adding spices into a pot, which is placed on a stove. He looks so concentrated, but he is definitely enjoying the cooking process. I like this picture because I am also keen on making meals for my family.

subQuestion.content: Which kind of food in those pictures is healthier?
subQuestion.suggestion: It would definitely be vegetables. Fruit and vegetables are a good source of vitamins and minerals, including vitamin C and other nutrients. They're an excellent source of dietary fibre, which can help to maintain a healthy gut and prevent digestion problems. A diet high in fibre can also reduce your risk of bowel cancer. By contrast, fast food contains high levels of fat and oil, which are contributors to obesity and cancer.

subQuestion.content: What are the benefits of them?
subQuestion.suggestion:
Fruit and vegetables are a good source of vitamins and minerals, including vitamin C and other nutrients. They're an excellent source of dietary fibre, which can help to maintain a healthy gut and prevent digestion problems. A diet high in fibre can also 

reduce your risk of bowel cancer.

questions.questionTitle: Speaking - BAO QUANH BỞI THIÊN NHIÊN  - Part 4
questions.content:
2 phút/ 3 câu - trả lời liên tục

  1. Tell me a time you were surrounded by nature.
  2. How did you feel?
  3. What are some advantages of getting close to nature?
questions.suggestion:
Tell me a time you were surrounded by nature.

  • Recently, I had the opportunity to engage in an outdoor activity that brought me immense joy. It was a hiking trip to a new national park with my close friends during the summer break. The activity took place last month in a picturesque national park known for its lush greenery and scenic trails. The day was perfect for hiking, with clear skies and a refreshing breeze. I did the activity with a group of friends from school, and we were all enthusiastic about exploring the natural beauty of the new location. The hike involved passing through a series of trails that led us through dense forests, alongside flowing streams, and eventually to a breathtaking waterfall. The experience was made even more enjoyable by the lively company of my friends, as we shared laughter, stories, and a sense of adventure.


How did you feel?

  •  I thoroughly enjoyed the outdoor activity. The combination of being surrounded by nature, the physical exertion of the hike, and the memories with friends created a joyful and memorable experience. The outdoor hiking activity in the new national park was a source of great happiness. It provided a perfect blend of nature, physical activity, and shared moments with friends, making it an experience I truly relished.


What are some advantages of getting close to nature? 

  • Spending time in green space or bringing nature into your everyday life can benefit both your mental and physical wellbeing. For example, doing things like growing food or flowers, exercising outdoors or being around animals can have lots of positive effects. Nature can help decrease your anxiety levels and can help lessen stress and feelings of anger, as well as lower risks of depression and improve concentration and attention.

subQuestion.suggestion: • There are several people in the picture, it looks like they are in a cinema. Some people are having a cup of soda, popcorns to enjoy the movie. They are creasing up together, it may well be that the movie they are watching is a comedy.

subQuestion.content: Tell me a time you laughed a lot
subQuestion.suggestion:
A time I laughed a lot was when I visited my best friend’s house. She lived with her family and they invited me to stay for dinner. We told funny stories during the meal and laughed a lot. After dinner, we went out to watch the latest movie at that time which was named: “Transformers”. The film was wonderful and we were all satisfied with the ending. 

Một lần tôi đã cười rất nhiều là khi tôi đến thăm nhà người bạn thân nhất của mình. Cô ấy sống với gia đình cô ấy và họ mời tôi ở lại ăn tối. Chúng tôi kể chuyện vui trong bữa ăn và cười rất nhiều. Sau bữa tối, chúng tôi ra ngoài xem bộ phim mới nhất lúc bấy giờ có tên là: “Transformers”. Bộ phim thật tuyệt vời và tất cả chúng tôi đều hài lòng với cái kết.

subQuestion.content: Do you think people from different countries laugh at different things?
subQuestion.suggestion:
Yes. People from different countries laugh at different things, I guess. I think it depends on cultural and social situations.

Normally, people laugh when they feel happy or see something funny, or when playing jokes.

In Japanese communication/conversations often involve a high level of respect, especially in professional cases. In such contexts, laughter might be seen as not suitable/ inappropriate. 

Đúng. Tôi đoán mọi người từ các quốc gia khác nhau cười vì những điều khác nhau. Tôi nghĩ rằng nó phụ thuộc vào các tình huống văn hóa và xã hội.

Thông thường, mọi người cười khi họ cảm thấy hạnh phúc hoặc thấy điều gì đó hài hước, hoặc khi đùa giỡn.

Trong giao tiếp/cuộc trò chuyện của người Nhật thường liên quan đến mức độ tôn trọng cao, đặc biệt là trong các trường hợp chuyên nghiệp. Trong những bối cảnh như vậy, cười lớn có thể bị coi là không phù hợp.

questions.content: Trả lời từng câu

subQuestion.content: Tell me what you see in two the pictures.
subQuestion.suggestion:
• Giống: Both pictures show places to eat/eating places. 
  • Khác:

In the first picture,...

But in the second picture,...

Regarding the differences, in the first picture, it is a popular restaurant/ a low-cost restaurant, in contrast, in the second picture, it is a high-class restaurant. 

  • Thích tranh nào hơn: I prefer picture 2 because I always have money to burn. 

Cả hai hình ảnh hiển thị những địa điểm ăn uống.

Trong bức tranh đầu tiên,...

Nhưng ở bức tranh thứ hai,...

Về sự khác biệt, ở hình 1 là quán bình dân/ bình dân, ngược lại ở hình 2 là nhà hàng cao cấp.

Tôi thích hình 2 hơn vì tôi luôn có tiền để đốt, tiêu xài.

subQuestion.content: What would it be like to eat in two places?
subQuestion.suggestion:
In a low-cost restaurant, we are offered a more budget-friendly and casual dining experience. The first place (pic 1) often has simpler menus. It means the dish may be basic and familiar. In addition, the atmosphere is designed to cater to a wide range of customers.

In a high-class restaurant, we can expect a more luxurious dining experience with a strong emphasis on quality and service. It offers a diverse and sophisticated menu and dishes are beautifully presented. The chefs need to focus on using high-quality ingredients and innovative cooking techniques. Service in a high-class restaurant is top-notch and often has staff members attending to customers’ needs. 

Trong một nhà hàng bình dân, chúng ta được cung cấp trải nghiệm ăn uống bình dân và hợp túi tiền hơn. Địa điểm đầu tiên  (ảnh 1) thường có menu đơn giản hơn. Có nghĩa là món ăn có thể cơ bản và quen thuộc. Ngoài ra, không khí nhà hàng được thiết kế để phục vụ cho nhiều đối tượng khách hàng.

Trong một nhà hàng cao cấp, chúng ta có thể mong đợi một trải nghiệm ăn uống sang trọng hơn với sự tập trung về chất lượng và dịch vụ. Nó cung cấp một thực đơn đa dạng và tinh tế, các món ăn được trình bày đẹp mắt. Các đầu bếp cần tập trung vào việc sử dụng nguyên liệu chất lượng cao và kỹ thuật nấu ăn độc đáo sáng tạo. Dịch vụ trong một nhà hàng cao cấp là hàng đầu và thường có nhân viên phục vụ nhu cầu của khách hàng.

subQuestion.content: Which of the two places would be healthier to eat in? Why?
subQuestion.suggestion:
It depends on a variety of factors including cooking methods, ingredients used, and menu options. However, high-class restaurants often prioritize quality ingredients and more diverse options. Portions there are typically smaller which can help control the amount of food we eat. 

Điều đó phụ thuộc vào nhiều yếu tố bao gồm phương pháp nấu ăn, nguyên liệu được sử dụng và các lựa chọn trong thực đơn. Tuy nhiên, nhà hàng cao cấp thường ưu tiên nguyên liệu chất lượng và lựa chọn đa dạng hơn. Các phần ăn thường nhỏ hơn có thể giúp kiểm soát lượng thức ăn chúng ta ăn.

questions.content:
2 phút/ 3 câu - trả lời liên tục

  1. Tell me a time you received a gift.
  2. How do you feel about this gift?
  3. Why do people give gifts?
questions.suggestion:
1. Tell me a time you received a gift.

The time that I received a gift was on my 18th birthday. My parents bought a car for me. My car is a Roll-Royce which is so expensive that only rich/wealthy people own it.

+Mô tả về quà: Only a few cars were sold worldwide because this model is a limited edition.

+Bối cảnh diễn ra: (thêm 1 ngày).

Lần mà tôi nhận được một món quà là vào ngày sinh nhật thứ 18 của tôi. Bố mẹ tôi đã mua một chiếc ô tô cho tôi. Xe của tôi là một chiếc Roll-Royce đắt đến mức chỉ những người giàu có mới sở hữu nó.

+Mô tả về quà tặng: Chỉ có một số ít xe được bán ra trên toàn thế giới vì đây là phiên bản giới hạn.


2. How do you feel about this gift?

Over the moon, grateful to my parents, and need to try my best to be rich like my parents,…

I was jumping for joy when I received this priceless gift. I felt grateful to my parents and told myself to try my best to be a savvy businessperson like my Dad. 

Sung sướng, biết ơn bố mẹ, cần phải cố gắng hết sức để giàu có như bố mẹ, …

Tôi đã nhảy cẫng lên vì sung sướng khi nhận được món quà vô giá này. Tôi cảm thấy biết ơn bố mẹ và tự nhủ phải cố gắng hết sức để trở thành một doanh nhân hiểu biết như bố tôi.


3. Why do people give gifts?

People give gifts for a variety of reasons.

  • Express their feelings/love

One of the primary reasons for giving gifts is to express love, affection, and appreciation to someone. It means gifts can convey emotions/messages that words alone may not capture. 

  • On special occasions

Gifts are often given to mark significant life events such as birthdays, weddings, anniversaries, and graduation that help celebrate and make these occasions memorable. 

  • Strengthen relationships

Gift-giving can foster relationships and be a way to nurture connections between people. 

Mọi người tặng quà vì nhiều lý do.

  • Thể hiện cảm xúc / tình yêu.
  • cảm xúc/thông điệp mà chỉ lời nói không thể nắm bắt được.
  • Vào những dịp đặc biệt

Quà tặng thường được tặng để đánh dấu các sự kiện quan trọng trong đời như sinh nhật, đám cưới, ngày kỷ niệm và tốt nghiệp để giúp kỷ niệm và làm cho những dịp này trở nên đáng nhớ.

  • Thắt chặt các mối quan hệ

Tặng quà có thể thúc đẩy các mối quan hệ và là một cách để nuôi dưỡng sự kết nối giữa mọi người.

questions.content:
2 phút/ 3 câu - trả lời liên tục

  1. Tell me about a time when you worked in a team.  
  2. How do you feel when you work in a team?  
  3. What are the advantages of teamwork?
questions.suggestion:
Tell me about a time when you worked in a team.  

  • I worked on a sales team where we needed to increase our monthly sales. I started a weekly meeting where the team could brainstorm and share our ideas for innovating and finding new sales tactics. I worked with colleagues to put these ideas into presentations, which we delivered to managers.

How do you feel when you work in a team?  

  •  Being part of a great team at work is an amazing feeling. You feel excited, challenged and safe at the same time. It also keeps you energized and pumped up throughout the day. 

What are the advantages of teamwork?  

  • Strong team dynamics enable individual members to divide complex projects into manageable tasks, which enhance productivity and enable an organization to function more effectively. Moreover, successful teamwork creates a supportive network that can significantly enhance job satisfaction and employee morale.

subQuestion.content: Is it It is important for people to learn to drive ? Why ?

In some cases, driving can be safer than using public transportation, especially if you are traveling alone or at night.

The last time I spoke in front of a lot of people was 5 months ago. When I was a leader in a group. This is the first time I have been the leader and present in front of a lot of people. Sau buổi nói ngày hôm đó tôi có thêm nhiều tự tin hơn, mạnh dạn hơn và tự biến mình thành một con người khác để thành công hơn.

subQuestion.content: Tell me what you see in the two pictures.

Cả hai bức ảnh đều thể hiện được những nơi ăn uống

  • Điểm khác: In picture 1, a girl is carrying food. She must be a waitress. The impression is the girl's radiant smile. I don't feel tired when doing this job, but very happy and comfortable. Certainly attracts a lot of customers. I guess this is a low restaurant.

In picture 2, the girl wears a serving outfit, comes to the customer's table and thoughtfully takes the order, with a respectful, considerate, warm attitude towards the customer. The space of the restaurant looks so sophisticated and luxurious. I guess this is a high quality restaurant.

Trong hình 1, một cô gái đang mang thức ăn. Cô ấy chắc hẳn là một cô hầu bàn. Ấn tượng là nụ cười rạng rỡ của cô gái. Tôi không cảm thấy mệt mỏi khi làm công việc này mà rất vui vẻ và thoải mái. Chắc chắn sẽ thu hút được rất nhiều khách hàng. Tôi đoán đây là một nhà hàng thấp.

Ở hình 2, cô gái mặc trang phục phục vụ, đến bàn khách và chu đáo nhận món, với thái độ tôn trọng, ân cần, niềm nở với khách. Không gian của nhà hàng nhìn rất tinh tế và sang trọng. Tôi đoán đây là một nhà hàng chất lượng cao.

subQuestion.content: What are the attractions of eating in these different places?
subQuestion.suggestion:
• Each place will have its own attractions.
  • Eating in a low restaurant, the food is cheap suitable for many people, you can eat more food, without having to pay attention to the same rules as in luxury restaurants.
  • Eating in a high restaurant, expressing elegance, politeness, beautifully decorated space, and on-site service. However, the food is expensive.

Each place has its own attractions. When people are eating in a low restaurant, the waiter will give them a menu, paper, and a pen to write down what to order. They will have more time to order and feel more comfortable. The food is suitable for many people, you can eat more food, without having to pay attention to the same rules as in luxury restaurants. When people are eating in a high restaurant, the waiter comes to the table to take down the customer’s order. That is the feeling that “the customer is king”. The restaurant is decorated beautifully and luxurious.

Mỗi nơi đều có những điểm hấp dẫn riêng. Khi mọi người dùng bữa ở một nhà hàng nhỏ, người phục vụ sẽ đưa cho họ thực đơn, giấy và bút để viết món cần gọi. Khách hàng sẽ có nhiều thời gian hơn để đặt hàng và cảm thấy thoải mái hơn. Món ăn phù hợp với nhiều người, bạn có thể ăn nhiều đồ ăn hơn mà không cần phải chú ý đến những quy tắc giống như ở những nhà hàng sang trọng. Khi mọi người đang dùng bữa trong một nhà hàng cao cấp, người phục vụ sẽ đến bàn ghi món ăn của khách hàng. Đó chính là cảm giác “khách hàng là thượng đế”. Nhà hàng được trang trí đẹp mắt và sang trọng.

subQuestion.content: Why do some people like to eat out on special occasions?
subQuestion.suggestion:
• Create precious memories, express luxury, politeness.
  • People are too lazy to do groceries or wash dishes after meals so, eating out is much more convenient.
  • People want to change of atmosphere.

Some people like to eat out on the special occasions.Because create precious memories, express luxury, politeness, people lazy to do groceries or wash dishes after meals so, eating out is much more convenient, for a change of atmosphere, eating out bring about new experience than at home.

Một số người thích đi ăn ngoài vào những dịp đặc biệt. Vì tạo ra những kỷ niệm quý giá, thể hiện sự sang trọng, lịch sự nên người ta lười đi chợ hay rửa bát sau bữa ăn nên việc đi ăn ngoài sẽ thuận tiện hơn nhiều, để thay đổi không khí, đi ăn ngoài mang lại cảm giác mới mẻ. trải nghiệm hơn ở nhà.

questions.content:
2 phút/ 3 câu - trả lời liên tục

  1. Tell me about a time when you were successful in a challenging situation.
  2. How do you feel when you are given a challenge?
  3. What can help people face the challenges of daily life?
questions.suggestion:
1. Tell me about a time when you were successful in a challenging situation.

  • Once in a situation where a client was very unhappy with a project’s results. They were threatening to cancel their contract and take their business elsewhere.
  • Then did some research and came up with a few possible solutions.
  • After presenting these options to the client, we were able to come to a resolution.

I was once in a situation where a client was very unhappy with a project’s results. They were threatening to cancel their contract and take their business elsewhere. I knew that if I didn't act quickly the company would lose a lot of money, so I sat down with the client and listened to their concerns. I then did some research and came up with a few possible solutions. After presenting these options to the client, we were able to come to a resolution that satisfied both parties.

Tôi đã từng rơi vào tình huống một khách hàng rất không hài lòng với kết quả của dự án. Họ đe dọa sẽ hủy hợp đồng và đưa công việc kinh doanh của họ đi nơi khác. Tôi biết rằng nếu tôi không hành động nhanh chóng thì công ty sẽ mất rất nhiều tiền, vì vậy tôi đã ngồi lại với khách hàng và lắng nghe những lo lắng của họ. Sau đó tôi đã thực hiện một số nghiên cứu và đưa ra một số giải pháp khả thi. Sau khi trình bày các lựa chọn này cho khách hàng, chúng tôi đã có thể đi đến giải pháp làm hài lòng cả hai bên.

2. How do you feel when you are given a challenge?

Certainly, the first I’m confused, scared, tired, unconfident to do it. Later, over the moon when successful it

Chắc chắn, lần đầu tiên tôi bối rối, sợ hãi, mệt mỏi, không tự tin để làm điều đó. Về sau, hạnh phúc khi làm thành công

 3. What can help people face the challenges of daily life?

  • Make a plan.
  • Confident yourself.
  • Accept support.

There are many ways to help people face challenges. Example make a plan. Planning will help them to take a step in the right direction. Confident yourself. Confidence helps people to be strong and not discouraged. Accept support. Accepting support is an advantage because someone shares part of the difficulty.


Có rất nhiều cách giúp mọi người đối mặt với những thách thức. Ví dụ Lên kế hoạch. Lập kế hoạch sẽ giúp họ thực hiện một bước đi đúng hướng. Tự tin vào bản thân. Sự tự tin giúp con người mạnh mẽ và không nản chí. Chấp nhận hỗ trợ. Chấp nhận hỗ trợ là một lợi thế vì có người chia sẻ một phần khó khăn

subQuestion.content: Please tell me about the last time you visited friends.
subQuestion.suggestion:
The last time I visited my friend was last weekend. She is wonderful and

kind. I visit (come over) my friend’s house once a week. We often had dinner

and went shopping together in the evening. That was very funny. We all felt

over the moon after that. Sometimes, I stay over at her house.

subQuestion.content: What is the food like in your country?
subQuestion.suggestion: I love (cooking) many dishes such as fried chicken, Pho or beef noodles but If I had to choose one, I would go for fried eggs. It is very easy to make. I often eat it for breakfast and sometimes for lunch and dinner. It is tasty/yummy/delicious when going with chili sauce.

subQuestion.content: Tell me about your country.
subQuestion.suggestion:
Giống PLACE (biến hoá nhẹ chút): My country has many beautiful places. Da Lat

City is an example. It is famous for its wild beauty and many coffee shops. The

weather is nice and cool. The people there are very kind and friendly and the food/

cuisine is so delicious. Plus, everything there is cheap/ expensive. People often go

to ... in the summer and autumn. All members of my family love this place.

subQuestion.content: Describe the picture.
subQuestion.suggestion:
(e viết mô tả dựa trên cấu trúc này nhé)


NGƯỜI:

1. (Số lượng + hành động) In the foreground, I can see... people who are (talking, eating,...). I guess they are (a family/a group of friends)...including:...

2. (Ngoại hình) They look professional in formal clothes./ They look so comfortable in casual clothes. Plus, they seem to be very excited.

VẬT:

1. (Cảnh vật) I think they are in (a kitchen, a classroom,...). The space is large/narrow. The weather is nice.

2. (Đồ vật) In the picture, I can see some interesting things:...,...,...

NẾU VẪN CHƯA HẾT THỜI GIAN: I love this picture at first sight because it reminds me of some wonderful moments with my family/ my friends.

  • I can see two people who are talking. I guess they are friends, including two men, with one wearing a yellow T-shirt and the other wearing a grey sweater. They look so comfortable in casual clothes. Plus, they seem to be very excited. I think they are in a clothing shop. The space is large. In the picture, I can see some interesting things: some vintage handbags, pairs of sneakers, and long-sleeved shirts.I love this picture at first sight because it reminds me of some wonderful moments with my friends.

subQuestion.content: Tell me about a time you went shopping with your friend.
subQuestion.suggestion: • I once went shopping with my best friend in a mall in the city centre. At first, we intended to buy some dresses for our next vacation, but then my friend and I decided to spend another hour at a thrift store together. Even though we spent a large sum of money on clothes, that was a fun and memorable experience that I would love to do with her in the future.

subQuestion.content: Some people are not interested in online shopping. How about you?
subQuestion.suggestion: • Personally, I love shopping online for various reasons. Online shopping can provide great convenience. You can access your online store anytime, anywhere and order it online and get it delivered to your home, without going to a physical store while still saving your money on gas and time. Most of the time shopping online offers cheaper prices because online shoppers do not need to pay the rent of an estate.

questions.content: Trả lời từng câu

subQuestion.content: Describe those pictures.
subQuestion.suggestion:
(e viết so sánh tranh dự trên cấu trúc bên dưới nhé)


Cấu trúc so sánh tranh

1.Điểm giống: The two pictures show/are related to + Chủ đề chính (Common topic).

Both of them look colorful.

2.Điểm khác:

+(NGƯỜI) In the first picture, I can see... people who are (talking, eating,...). I guess they are (a family/a group of friends)...including:... They look so... in... clothes

Likewise, there is/are ... people in the second photo. I think they are ... They look very...in...clothes.

+(VẬT) The picture on the left shows ... in the background. The space/ the weather is...

By contrast, the picture on the right shows... The space/ the weather is...


3. Cảm nhận: I am impressed by the first one/ second one because it reminds me of some wonderful memories.

  •  The two pictures show people in different travel destinations. Both of them look colorful. In the first picture, I can see many people who are lying and playing on a beach. They look so comfortable in swimming clothes. Likewise, there is a woman in the second photo. She looks very cozy in her warm clothes. The picture on the left shows the sea in the background. The space/ the weather is very hot. By contrast, the picture on the right shows a lake in the winter. The space/ the weather is freezing cold. I am impressed by the first one/ second one because it reminds me of some wonderful memories.

subQuestion.content: Do you like going to crowded beaches?
subQuestion.suggestion: • No one loves going to crowded beaches. Most of the time, crowded beaches are filled with lots of trash since there are many people who are not educated about environmental protection and the management policy is not proper. Also, I love quiet beaches where I can surf and play beach games without being limited by others’ presence.

subQuestion.content: Why do many people like quiet places?
subQuestion.suggestion: • Because it's relaxing and you can get your thoughts together without any interruptions. A quiet place is something that helps us feel relaxed and comfortable, and clear our mind. Most people prefer quiet places whenever they feel low. They prefer to stay alone for some time, to get a peaceful mind and improve concentration

questions.content:
2 phút/ 3 câu - trả lời liên tục

  1. Tell me about a time when someone was rude to you.
  2. What do you think?
  3. Do you think technology is changing people's thoughts, making them more uncommunicative?
questions.suggestion:
Tell me about a time when someone was rude to you.

  • Last winter, I was at a small bookstore in my neighborhood, searching for a new novel to read. The shop was cozy, with wooden shelves and a warm, inviting atmosphere. I noticed a book on a high shelf that caught my eye but couldn’t reach it. I politely asked a clerk to help me. The clerk rolled his eyes, walked over and grabbed the book. He practically shoved it into my hands and turned away before I could respond. His rudeness left me feeling confused, but I decided not to let it ruin my day. I bought the book, left the store, and never went back to that bookstore again.


What do you think?

  • I was so confused at first when the clerk didn’t say a word but showed an unfriendly attitude to me even though I was being nice and polite. However, I think he might have had a bad day and, despite being a bit irritated, I felt sympathetic with him and did not let that ruin my day.


Do you think technology is changing people's thoughts, making them more uncommunicative? 

  • No, I think, on one hand, technology has made it easier to connect with people across the globe instantly via social media, messaging apps, and video calls regardless of geographical distances. However, with the convenience of digital communication, people might rely less on in-person interactions. This can lead to a decrease in face-to-face conversations. So, it has both positive and negative impacts and how we use it to better our lives is key.

subQuestion.content: Describe the room you are in.
subQuestion.suggestion:
CON NGƯỜI: In this room, I can see many people: 3 teachers (examiners/ supervisors) and 20 students (examinees, test takers). The teachers look very serious, they are walking around to make sure everything runs smoothly. The students look very confident.

KHÔNG GIAN: The room is quite large/ small.

ĐỒ VẬT: I can see many computers and headsets on desks for candidates.

subQuestion.content: Please tell me about the last thing you saw on television.
subQuestion.suggestion: (WHAT) The last thing I saw on TV was a movie. (HOW) It was interesting. (HOW OFTEN) I watch TV twice a week at home on weekends. (WHEN) In the evening, after dinner, I open the TV and watch with my mom (WHO). That movie was great and we felt over the moon (HOW). It helps me reduce stress after a long day. (LỢI ÍCH)

subQuestion.content: What is the food like in your country?
subQuestion.suggestion: I love (cooking) many dishes such as fried chicken, Pho or beef noodles but If I had to choose one, I would go for fried eggs. It is very easy to make. I often eat it for breakfast and sometimes for lunch and dinner. It is tasty/yummy/delicious when going with chili sauce.

questions.questionTitle: Speaking - GIẢI QUYẾT MỘT VẤN ĐỀ - Part 2

subQuestion.content: Describe the picture.
How difficult is it for young people to learn to cook these days?
subQuestion.suggestion:
(Giới trẻ ngày nay khó khăn như thế nào trong việc học nấu ăn?)

  • Yes, I agree that it is difficult for young people to learn how to cook these days. First, you know what, many young people like me are very busy with work, study and other activities, which makes finding time to cook meals so hard. Second, it is so convenient to order delicious dishes on some apps like Shopee Food, Beamin and so on. Finally, young people enjoy being served food at restaurants. 


 Đúng, tôi đồng ý rằng giới trẻ ngày nay học nấu ăn rất khó. Đầu tiên, bạn biết không, nhiều người trẻ như tôi rất bận rộn với công việc, học tập và các hoạt động khác nên việc tìm thời gian để nấu bữa ăn trở nên khó khăn. Thứ hai, thật tiện lợi khi đặt những món ăn ngon trên một số ứng dụng như Shopee Food, Beamin, v.v. Cuối cùng, giới trẻ thích được phục vụ đồ ăn tại nhà hàng.

subQuestion.content: When was the last time you went out to eat?
subQuestion.suggestion:
• Ok. Let me remember. The last time I went out to eat was on one of my friends’ birthday. I was invited to come and join her party. I bought an expensive handbag from LV for her. 


On that day, after I came home from work, I took a shower and got dressed to be beautiful then I went to her house. Everything was ready. After the party, I went home and read some books. Finally, I went to bed and called my boyfriend. (phát triển từ “Làm gì trong 1 ngày: ra nè, dễ không)

 Được rồi. Hãy để tôi nhớ lại. Lần cuối cùng tôi đi ăn là vào ngày sinh nhật của một người bạn. Tôi được mời đến và tham gia bữa tiệc của cô ấy. Tôi đã mua cho cô ấy một chiếc túi xách đắt tiền từ hãng LV.

Hôm đó, sau khi đi làm về, tôi tắm rửa, thay đồ thật đẹp rồi sang nhà cô ấy. Mọi thứ đã sẵn sàng. Sau bữa tiệc, tôi về nhà và đọc vài cuốn sách. Cuối cùng, tôi đi ngủ và gọi điện cho bạn trai.

questions.questionTitle: Speaking - GIẢI QUYẾT MỘT VẤN ĐỀ - Part 3
questions.content: Trả lời từng câu

subQuestion.content: Describe the two pictures.
What are the differences between life in the countryside and in the city?
subQuestion.suggestion:
(Sự khác biệt giữa cuộc sống ở nông thôn và thành phố là gì?)

  • There are various differences between life in the countryside and in the city. First, in the countryside, there is more open space and cleaner air and less noise. There, the living cost is lower than that in the city but there are fewer services like restaurants or food ordering apps. In contrast, the city has more job opportunities and more noise. 

Có nhiều sự khác biệt giữa cuộc sống ở nông thôn và thành phố. Thứ nhất, ở nông thôn có nhiều không gian thoáng đãng, không khí trong lành hơn và ít tiếng ồn hơn. Ở đó, chi phí sinh hoạt thấp hơn ở thành phố nhưng có ít dịch vụ hơn như nhà hàng hay ứng dụng đặt đồ ăn. Ngược lại, thành phố có nhiều cơ hội việc làm hơn và nhiều tiếng ồn hơn.

  • You need to consider the pros and cons before choosing the place to live. 

Bạn cần cân nhắc những ưu và nhược điểm trước khi lựa chọn nơi sinh sống.

subQuestion.content: Do you prefer living in the countryside or living in the city?
subQuestion.suggestion:
(Bạn thích sống ở nông thôn hay sống ở thành phố?)

  • For me, I like both of those places. Why do I have to choose? To be more convenient for my work and study, I still live in the cities. On holidays or weekends, I go back to the countryside - my hometown to unwind. Coming back to my home helps me recharge my energy for the upcoming week.

Đối với tôi, tôi thích cả hai nơi đó. Tại sao tôi phải lựa chọn? Để thuận tiện hơn cho công việc và học tập, tôi vẫn sống ở thành phố. Vào những ngày nghỉ lễ hoặc cuối tuần, tôi lại về quê - quê hương của mình để thư giãn. Trở về nhà giúp tôi nạp lại năng lượng cho tuần sắp tới.

questions.questionTitle: Speaking - GIẢI QUYẾT MỘT VẤN ĐỀ - Part 4
questions.content:
2 phút/ 3 câu - trả lời liên tục

  1. Tell me about a time you solved a problem.
  2. How do you feel when you can’t solve a problem?
  3. Technology causes more problems than the ones that it can solve. What do you think about it?
questions.suggestion:
1. Tell me about a time you solved a problem.

=> MB: I face many challenges and problems during my learning process. (có thể gộp với đề facing a challenge)

=> TB:

· A time I solved a problem was last year which was that I didn’t pass the examination even though I worked so hard. As a senior high school student, I was busy with my studies. My day used to begin at 6 a.m. After that, I had a quick breakfast that my mom cooked for me… (đánh lái qua câu “Làm gì trong 1 ngày” cho tới hết 1p30 or 1p40s) 

· Initially/ At first, I was frightened, worried, and dry. Later, I calmed down and solved it. I advised myself not to delay/put off. I asked myself to be stronger and not dampen. I was more hard-working/effort/determined. The result was I passed the examination. I was pleased/ proud …..


 => MB: Tôi gặp rất nhiều khó khăn, thử thách trong quá trình học tập. (có thể di chuyển theo chủ đề đang đối mặt với thử thách)

=> TB:

· Một lần tôi đã giải quyết được một vấn đề là vào năm ngoái, đó là tôi đã không vượt qua kỳ thi mặc dù tôi đã học tập rất chăm chỉ. Khi còn là học sinh cấp 3, tôi bận rộn với việc học. Một ngày của tôi thường bắt đầu lúc 6 giờ sáng. Sau đó, tôi ăn bữa sáng nhanh do mẹ nấu cho.

· Ban đầu/ Lúc đầu tôi sợ hãi, lo lắng và khô khan. Sau đó, tôi bình tĩnh lại và giải quyết nó. Tôi tự khuyên mình không nên trì hoãn/ trì hoãn. Tôi tự hỏi mình phải mạnh mẽ hơn và không chùn bước. Tôi đã làm việc chăm chỉ/nỗ lực/quyết tâm hơn. Kết quả là tôi đã vượt qua kỳ thi. Tôi hài lòng/tự hào…..

2. How do you feel when you can’t solve a problem?

· Certainly, I feel awful/ furious,…

· I feel regret, failing,…

· Chắc chắn là tôi cảm thấy khủng khiếp/tức giận,…

· Tôi cảm thấy tiếc nuối, thất bại,…


3. Technology causes more problems than the ones that it can solve. What do you think about it?

Thần chú: Đọc lại câu hỏi + Cụm kéo dài thời gian. 

Technology causes…. It is an interesting question but to be honest, I have never thought about it before. So what can I say? Uhm. The first thing I have to say is that technology helps in many ways but it also brings new challenges. I believe it has both positive and negative sides (hoặc good and bad sides). 

(Đoạn này đọc lại câu hỏi nè)…. Đó là một câu hỏi thú vị nhưng thành thật mà nói, tôi chưa bao giờ nghĩ về nó trước đây. Vậy tôi có thể nói gì đây? Ừm. Điều đầu tiên tôi phải nói là công nghệ giúp ích về nhiều mặt nhưng nó cũng mang đến những thách thức mới. Tôi tin rằng nó có cả mặt tích cực và tiêu cực (hoặc mặt tốt và mặt xấu).

Cụ thể hơn (dành cho các bạn aim C):

  • Excessive use of technology can lead to feelings of loneliness
  • Technology brings out cybersecurity risks: hacking, cyberattacks,...

Sử dụng công nghệ quá mức có thể dẫn đến cảm giác lạc lõng

Công nghệ mang đến những rủi ro về an ninh mạng: hack, tấn công mạng,...

subQuestion.content: Please tell me about your favorite film star/
subQuestion.suggestion: One of my favorite film stars is Audrey Hepburn. She stood out not only for her beauty and elegance in films like Breakfast at Tiffany's and Roman Holiday, but also for her humanitarian work, especially with UNICEF. Hepburn remains an icon in both cinema and humanitarian efforts.

The last time I went shopping was last week. This was a gift to congratulate me on studying well. I went shopping through many stores with my mother. Tôi mua rất nhiều quần áo, đầm, phụ kiện,…Tôi thích nhất là chiếc váy hoa màu xanh. Nó phù hợp với làn da và mái tóc của tôi. Đồng thời, nó có thể được đeo trong nhiều hoàn cảnh. subQuestion.content: Shopping online or buying at a physical store?

Tuy nhiên người tiêu dùng không được xem trực tiếp, không kiểm chứng được chất lượng. Mua hàng ở cửa hàng lại không phù hợp với người bận bịu,nhưng người tiêu dùng được xem sản phẩm trực tiếp.

questions.questionTitle: Speaking - Làm điều mà mình không muốn - Part 4
questions.content:
2 phút/ 3 câu - trả lời liên tục

  1. A time you did something you didn’t like. 
  2. Do you prefer the job you love or the job that helps you make a lot of money?
  3. In today's society, we often find ourselves having to do many things we don't enjoy, both in social settings and within our families.
questions.suggestion:
A time you did something you didn’t like. 

Last week, I had to tackle my discomfort with teamwork on a challenging assignment with classmates. It was tough at first, with disagreements and frustrations. I prefer working alone, and teamwork feels challenging.

However, as we progressed, I began to see the value in our diverse strengths. Our collaboration resulted in a more comprehensive outcome than I could achieve alone. Despite the initial discomfort, the experience taught me important lessons about teamwork and the strength of different perspectives. It turned out to be a worthwhile endeavor, bringing personal and professional growth.


Do you prefer the job you love or the job that helps you make a lot of money?

I would choose a job that provides a higher income for me because I need money to support my life and send money back to my family. On the other hand, my true passion lies in luxury items, so it's challenging for me to admit that I don't have a passion for art or things that require finesse. I only have a small dream: to open a flower shop when I retire, around the age of 40, and I will run it without seeking profits.


In today's society, we often find ourselves having to do many things we don't enjoy, both in social settings and within our families.

In today's society, it's common to face tasks and responsibilities that we may not enjoy, both in social situations and within our families. Whether it's meeting certain expectations or handling responsibilities, there are often aspects of life that require us to step out of our comfort zones. Despite the challenges, navigating these situations can lead to personal growth and a better understanding of ourselves. It's a reminder that life is a mix of both enjoyable and challenging moments, and learning to adapt can be a valuable skill.

subQuestion.content: Describe the picture.

The teacher is pointing at a picture, probably describing the picture to the kids. The kids are listening to their teacher attentively.

subQuestion.content: What kind of games did you play when you were a child?
subQuestion.suggestion:
When I was a child, I played chess with my brother every day. He taught me how to play chess and he was also my opponent in this kind of game.  Besides, I liked playing

online games on the computer with my friends. We used to meet up at one of our friends’ houses to play video games together.

subQuestion.content: Why do children spend time playing?
subQuestion.suggestion: Play is essential for children's development. It's their way of learning, exploring concepts and practicing skills through building, pretending, or any activity that sparks their curiosity. This play not only fuels cognitive growth and physical development but also fosters social skills like sharing and cooperation. Additionally, play provides a much-needed outlet for relaxation and enjoyment, contributing to a child's overall well-being.

questions.questionTitle: Speaking - Giúp đỡ người khác - Part 3
questions.content: Trả lời từng câu

subQuestion.content: Tell me what you see in the two pictures.
subQuestion.suggestion:
In the left photo, there is a woman holding a cat in her arms. The cat is orange and she is looking at it endearingly. There is also a vase in the living room. 

In the right photo, a boy is playing with a worm. He is observing it attentively. There are trees behind him.

subQuestion.content: What are the attractions of keeping these animals as pets?
subQuestion.suggestion: The allure of keeping pets is multifaceted. They offer companionship, combating loneliness and providing a sense of belonging. Studies even show they can lower stress and anxiety. Pets shower us with unwavering loyalty and affection, their greetings really make our day. Their playful personalities and antics entertain us, bringing laughter and joy. Caring for a pet creates a sense of purpose and routine, teaching responsibility and empathy, especially valuable for children and older adults. Pets can even connect us with nature, fostering a love for the natural world. Overall, the human-animal bond is powerful, enriching our lives in countless ways.

subQuestion.content: Some say animals should not be kept in the home. What do you think?
subQuestion.suggestion: I don’t agree that animals should not be kept in the home. Owning certain domesticated animals can bring wonderful benefits to both the pet and the people living in the home. Pets can offer companionship, combating loneliness and providing a sense of belonging. Studies even suggest they can improve our physical and mental health by lowering stress and encouraging exercise. Caring for a pet fosters responsibility and empathy, especially valuable for children, while also creating a routine that brings a sense of purpose. Most importantly, these advantages apply to animals well-suited for domestic life. For wild animals, a home environment can be far from ideal, so it's vital to always research an animal's specific needs before welcoming them into your life.

questions.questionTitle: Speaking - Giúp đỡ người khác - Part 4
questions.content:
2 phút/ 3 câu - trả lời liên tục

  1. A time when you gave help?
  2. How did you feel?
  3. How can people be encouraged to do good things?
questions.suggestion:
- A time when you gave help?

- How did you feel?

- How can people be encouraged to do good things?

The last time I helped someone was last week. To the best of my recollection, when I was jogging in the park, I found a wallet on the path. I immediately looked for the park guard and gave it to him. About ten minutes later, an owner came and obtained it. He felt so grateful that he even invited me to dinner to say thanks. But I rejected him because I think giving back what is not yours is my responsibility and I am happy to help others.

I felt so proud and delighted when I was able to help someone. When I help others, I am also helping myself and my self-esteem. I start feeling like I am finally good for something in this life. I quite literally feel like a million bucks.

 I believe that to encourage more people to get involved in doing good things, we can make them believe that when they help someone, good luck will come back to them. Besides, if they help others frequently, they will receive help when they need it. People can also be led by example. Demonstrating kindness and compassion in your own actions can inspire others to follow suit.

questions.questionTitle: Speaking - Cười lớn cùng bạn bè - Part 4
questions.content:
2 phút/ 3 câu - trả lời liên tục

  1. Tell me about a time you laughed with your friends.
  2. What do you think of a cheerful person?
  3. ﻿hy do people laugh at different things?
questions.suggestion:
1. Tell me about a time you laughed with your friends.

  • A time when I creased up with my friends was last weekend, when my friends and I hung out together.A friend of mine, Timothy ,loves making some silly and stupid things on purpose like tripping and falling on the floor, making silly jokes and lots more. And he always succeed in cracking me up uncontrollably

2. What do you think of a cheerful person?

A cheerful person is a carefree one, who will live their life as per the flow, blindly, but they live to the fullest. They are often the sweetest, kind hearted and generous people you will ever find. These people will definitely make you feel at ease by their sense of humore and positivity they bring to people surrounding them. Therefore, I absolutely love being around cheerful and opstimistic people as they are always the life and soul of any party they take part in.

3. Why do people laugh at different things?

Because individuals have different senses of humor. Therefore, some may find a joke or punchline funny, while some don’t, and vice versa. Also, this can be related to diverse cultures among countries and religions. For example, while making jokes baout politicians or leaders in America might be funny to Americans, it is illegal in Vietnam.

subQuestion.content: How important is it to do daily exercises?
subQuestion.suggestion: •  Regular physical activity is one of the most important things you can do for your health. Being physically active can improve your brain health, help manage weight, reduce the risk of disease, strengthen bones and muscles, and improve your ability to do everyday activities.

subQuestion.content: What the difference of these two exercises ?
subQuestion.suggestion: • They are gym and hiking. When you hike, you train your body to work as it is designed. This involves lots of muscles all working in synergy, adapting to the situation as required. Gyms often lack this by exercising muscles in only one motion.

questions.content:
2 phút/ 3 câu - trả lời liên tục

  1. Please tell me about a time you received good news.
  2. How did you feel when waiting for important news?
  3. Why do you think people enjoy celebrating good news?
questions.suggestion:
Please tell me about a time you received good news.

  • That year, 2018, my family and I celebrated Christmas when we received some fantastic news about my brother. The message also included details on the scholarship program he had been accepted into at MIT. Furthermore, my whole family was overjoyed by the unbelievable news, as we never imagined that he would get this, given that MIT is widely regarded as one of the world’s finest institutions for technological education.

How did you feel when waiting for important news?

  • I felt extremely nervous and preoccupied with any possible outcome I could think of. However, I also try to calm myself and pull myself together, crossing my fingers for the best. Even though shivering and waiting for something you have expected a long time to come true might be an unpleasant, it is the very moment that I remember the most as I am always encouraged and supported by my loved ones no matter what will happen.

Why do you think people enjoy celebrating good news?

  • Yes, I think that whenever people achieve something, they will definitely throw a party to it. Because it can provide a sense of hope and optimism, which can be especially important during difficult times. Socially considered, this activity can help enhance social connections. Good news can bring people together and strengthen social bonds. Sharing positive news with others can foster a sense of community and connection. Also, on achieving an important milestone in one’s life, celebrating is a good manner to highlight that special event and create unforgetable memories.
